programme.desc: Ronan Keating and Jermaine Jenas present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Zack comes up with a plan to honour his and Whitney's lost child and Lexi gets frustrated with Emma on Mother's Day. Freddie treats Jean to a slap-up lunch at The Vic and Ravi flirts with Chelsea in an attempt to put pressure on Denise to gain access to Jack's files

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: In-depth current affairs report covering a story behind the headlines

programme.title: Scarlett's Driving School
programme.desc: Single mother Amy is desperate to learn to drive to improve the lives of her kids. But after 13 years learning and two failed tests under the instruction of her own mother, both feel they are going backwards. During five days, they must try and stop Amy's panic attacks while driving

programme.title: The Gold: The Inside Story
programme.desc: The true story of Britain's biggest bullion heist, featuring the personal accounts of the police officers who investigated the 1983 robbery at the Brink's-Mat security depot. Speaking for the first time since the robbery, Detective Chief Superintendent Brian Boyce and DC Tony Yeoman reveal the challenges they faced, the strategy they took and the tragedy that unfolded as they staked out Kenneth Noye, one of the men at the epicentre of the gang transforming the gold into cash

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Alan Yentob joins director Stephen Frears on the Vienna set of forthcoming drama The Palace, and looks back his career while exploring the city. Frears looks back on his breakthrough in the theatre, at the Royal Court in London in the early 1960s, through BBC's Play for Today to his movie breakthrough with My Beautiful Laundrette and Dangerous Liaisons. With contributions from Hugh Grant, Judi Dench, Steve Coogan, Hanif Kureishi, Glenn Close, John Malkovich, Jack Black, Helen Mirren and Meryl Streep

programme.title: Philomena (2013)
programme.desc: A teenager in 1950s Ireland becomes pregnant, and is sent to a home for 'fallen women', while her baby is forcibly taken from her and sent to America to be adopted. Fifty years later, she meets a disillusioned political journalist who attempts to reunite her with her son. Fact-based drama, starring Judi Dench and Steve Coogan

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Anna Maxwell Martin hosts an extended edition of the satirical panel show, with Steph McGovern and Chris McCausland joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.desc: Jon Kay and Sally Nugent present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Crimewatch Live
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and Michelle Ackerley appeal for information from the public about crimes around the country

programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: A police officer uses his medical training to save two stab victims in Warwickshire and a paramedic is violently attacked in Manchester City Centre. Stab vests are trialled on ambulance workers in Wolverhampton

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A couple buy a house at auction near Swansea and make it a family home. Meanwhile, developers invest in properties in Haynes and Great Yarmouth with hopes of renting them out

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Kate Bliss and Mark Stacey help two teams scour an antiques fair in Harrogate, North Yorkshire, while presenter Anita Manning catches up with series regular Charles Hanson to discuss a very special musical collection

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: It is peer review day at The Mill and Nina is struggling to make it work with the staff who are less than excited

programme.title: Jay and Dom's Home Fix
programme.desc: Jay demonstrates how to organise messy drawers and Dom makes a handy hanging shelf. In the main build, it's all about bedroom furniture

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps a couple from Miami move to Cheshire and takes the opportunity to visit a factory specialising in hand-printed luxury garments

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Irita Marriott and Phil Serrell are on a tour of Norfolk and Lincolnshire, where he encounters a great bustard and she catches a rare bird from the 1930s

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Family team Andy, Karen, Caroline and Sue try to find the right path across the bridge in the hope of winning some cash. Game show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman

programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Stacey is shocked to find out where Freddie is getting his money from and Lola worries Emma has rejected her again. Zack asks some important questions at the clinic but it might be too late for him and Whitney

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: The designers head to Scotland for their next challenge, making-over a hotel room at a five-star golf and spa resort with just two days and a budget of 2,000. Half of the competitors are given a brief for a maximalist design for the hotel's more outdoorsy guests, while the others must create a tranquil space for those looking for a relaxing spa visit. With a double elimination looming, the designers pull out all the tricks they have up their sleeves to impress Alan, Michelle and guest judge Matthew Williamson

programme.title: Anton & Giovanni's Adventures in Sicily
programme.desc: Strictly Come Dancing stars Anton Du Beke and Giovanni Pernice embark on a tour of Giovanni's homeland Sicily, beginning in the port town of Sciacca. Their first stop is the Valley of the Temples, the remains of a huge Greek city featuring some of the best examples of classical Greek architecture anywhere in the world. From there, they hit the white beaches of Porta Bianca before taking in some more history in Syracuse. Today, it is just a provincial city, but more than 2,700 years ago it was one of the largest colonies in the ancient Greek world, and some of the original buildings remain inside the city's Archaeological Park. Their final stop is the island's second city Catania, a place very significant to Giovanni as he moved there aged 14 to further his dance career

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Official Secrets (2019)
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about the publication of a leaked GCHQ memo in the run-up to the Iraq war. The film reveals the devastating consequences for whistleblower Katharine Gun, who was put on trial for breaching the Official Secrets Act, and the journalists who were determined to unmask a conspiracy. Keira Knightley and Matt Smith star

programme.title: The Apprentice
programme.desc: Some familiar faces return to interrogate the business plans of the final five and there's tears, turmoil and tough talking as the candidates battle to back their statements and ideas. However, a deep dive into their proposals reveal fictitious figures, crazy concepts and absurd ambitions. For at least one hopeful it's the end of the road as a disgruntled Lord Sugar shows them the door

programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: A police car in North Yorkshire take a hit when a car thief is desperate to escape and a paramedic uses her experience with her own mental health issues to help others. The West Midlands Drone Unit demonstrates the essential part their high-tech equipment plays in today's policing

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell follow the development progress of a bungalow in Derbyshire, a three-bedroom semi in Burton-on-Trent and a Staffordshire property

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross and experts Thomas Forrester and Stephanie Connell go antique hunting in Brackley, Northamptonshire, before heading to Stratford-upon-Avon for the latest auction. Charlie is also going all to pot as he discovers the canal communities favourite type of earthenware

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: The peer reviews left things frosty between the staff and Kirsty deals with Ollie's unwelcome surprise. Ruhma's colleague delivers her 5,000th birth but things don't go to plan

programme.title: Jay and Dom's Home Fix
programme.desc: Jay Blades and Dominic Chinea's imaginations are put to the test when they make different versions of children's furniture. The duo also revamp an old lampshade and make a simple key holder. Plus, from the archives, Alan Titchmarsh returfs a lawn, and Joe Swift and Carol Klein reveal their favourite tools for gardening

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps a young animal loving couple who have a budget of 750,000 search for a new home in Norfolk

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Irita Marriott and Phil Serrell reach Yorkshire, where dedicated follower of fashion Irita finds out about haute couture, 1890s Hull-style, while Phil is turned into a pumpkin

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Ross Kemp hosts the game show, challenging friends Louise, Glen, Laura and Jack to find a safe path across the bridge, choosing the truths and avoiding the lies

programme.title: Pointless

programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Magazine show, with stories of interest from around the UK, plus celebrity guests in the studio

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Whitney and Zack agree to talk about their issues. Meanwhile, Denise and Jack find themselves in a tough situation on family games night. Stacey is relieved to have the cash to pay off the loan shark but when they demand more on short notice she has a tough decision to make

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team restore a painting belonging to a Ukrainian family who risked everything to conserve their family history, and a 1963 calendar from Liverpool's Cavern Club that was used to book The Beatles. Also brought into the shop is an 18ft homemade kayak and a leather swivel chair that evokes precious memories of a beloved father and grandfather

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: Five teams race 16,000 kilometres across the breadth of Canada starting from Vancouver on the Pacific coastline and passing through seven checkpoints before reaching St Johns on the island of Newfoundland, the most easterly town in North America. Their skill, ingenuity and determination are put to the test as they embark on their journey without access to smartphones, the internet or credit cards. Armed with only the cash equivalent of the airfare to fly their route, the teams travel at ground level through some of the most remote regions in the world

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Jerk
programme.desc: Tim is invited to parliament to take part in a Select Committee for the new disability funding act, but when Lily shows up and gets him thrown out, he swears revenge. Idris' mum visits to keep an eye on his new business venture but she turns out to be an alt-right conspiracy theorist who sets out on a crusade to turn his bookshop into a temple of bigotry

programme.title: Jerk
programme.desc: Lily's latest scam is at risk when Tim runs into his nemesis Kiefer. Idris is roped into keeping the scam alive but is slowly broken down by Aaliyah's doom and Ruth's insults leading him to embrace the darkness. Can Tim save the day?

programme.title: Live NBA
programme.desc: Dallas Mavericks v Golden State Warriors (Tip-off 11.30pm). Coverage of the Western Conference clash at American Airlines Centre

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Walks of Life
programme.desc: Mehreen Baig explores the Lake District in a spiritual journey inspired by the work of poet William Wordsworth, beginning with a visit to a holy shrine only accessible at low tide

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp and Philip Serrell continue seeking items of value, on a tour of East Ayrshire and Dumfries and Galloway. Natasha picks up a silver tea caddy and a first edition Virginia Woolf collection of books. Philip discovers just why collecting ancient musical instruments was a status symbol in the 19th century. He also finds a beautiful watercolour by a local artist, but is distracted by some very tasty looking homemade scones

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: The chef champions the food, history and culture of the county, foraging for mussels in his favourite rock pools, and touring Bodmin Moor's dark past with his son Jack. He also cooks a fool-proof souffle with artisan Cornish goat's cheese

programme.title: Weatherman Walking: The Welsh Coast
programme.desc: Derek Brockway fires the starting cannon at the Beaumaris Regatta on Anglesey, then embarks on a 14-mile walk initially taking him into the town's heavily fortified castle before heading onto the Welsh Coast Path. Derek visits the hamlet of Penmon, before heading to the photogenic Black Nose lighthouse with views over Puffin Island. The walk turns inland for a couple of miles before arriving at a new stretch of path, which has been moved much closer to the headland with fine sea views. Derek's eventual destination is Red Wharf Bay, a wide sandy bay on the east coast of the island

programme.desc: The latest headlines, breaking news and sport from the BBC newsroom.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win 10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore the popularity of sugar-rich foods in Britain, and try to make their own versions of their favourite childhood sweets. The duo also prepare a cheesecake and a sweet-and-sour dish

programme.title: Eat Well for Less?
programme.desc: Glasgow couple Karen and Andy Stirrat have triplets, one of who is trialling a new chemotherapy drug while fighting an aggressive brain tumour. With so many hospital visits it's understandable that cooking and eating routines have fallen by the wayside. The pair tend to rely on ready meals and quick fixes, meaning lots of the food that Karen intended to cook ends up in the bin. Chris Bavin and Jordan Banjo want to get the family cooking more from scratch, so offer quick-and-easy recipe ideas. Plus, Jordan tries to boost Andy's confidence in the kitchen and Chris looks at how 21st-century tech might be able to help reduce waste

programme.title: The World's Most Extraordinary Homes
programme.desc: Award-winning architect Piers Taylor and actress and property enthusiast Caroline Quentin explore extraordinary homes around the world. In the opening episode, the pair travel to Portugal, where they come across four very different properties. First, they visit a ultramodern house located in the Portuguese Riviera, before travelling to Penela, to view a property owned by British ex-pats Neil and Shirley. The pair then visit a house built within a pine forest near the Atlantic coast, before ending their trip at a property hidden in the mountainous region of Peneda-Geres National Park

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp and Raj Bisram value some Spiritualist photographs and a Hornby train set at Culzean Castle, while Paul Martin follows in the footsteps of Robert Burns

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall, Jodie Kidd, Jamali Maddix and Suzi Perry go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Colin Murray and Edith Bowman check out the food and festivities on offer at Belfast's Mela Festival, from Korean kimchi and Jamaican patties, to cockles and sticky toffee pudding. Later, farmer Jim Smith raises a glass to non-alcoholic beer, wine and spirits

programme.title: Between the Covers
programme.desc: Sara Cox is joined by comedians Alan Davies and Ivo Graham and actresses Samantha Bond and Sunetra Sarker, who champion their favourite books. The guests also review this week's two book club choices, which are The Space Between Us by Doug Johnstone and Lullaby by Leila Slimani

programme.title: Saving Lives at Sea
programme.desc: A volunteer in Scotland has to rescue his own father, whose fishing boat is drifting powerless towards a rocky shoreline. In Bristol, a father and son are among the crew that comes to the aid of two five-year-old girls who have drifted into the Bristol Channel on an inflatable, while in Ilfracombe, lifeboat volunteers race against time to save a mother and her daughter stranded at the base of huge sea cliffs

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: Clive Myrie hosts the second semi-final of the quiz, with four returning contenders answering questions on the specialist subjects of the Norman Conquest, Borussia Dortmund, popes of the Renaissance, and the film musicals of Alan Menken, before facing the general knowledge round

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: In the fourth of the quarter-finals, two teams of four students compete to make it to the next stage of the competition as they try to win two matches and progress to the semi-finals. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace goes behind the scenes at a factory in Scarborough, North Yorkshire, where London's famous red double-decker buses are built, finding out what goes into making the electric model. Cherry Healey visits a factory where she gets to grips with the construction of tough laminated heated windscreens for buses, while historian Ruth Goodman learns about London's earliest double deckers and the vital role they played in the First World War

programme.title: Detectorists
programme.desc: After recent revelations, Lance, Andy, Becky and Sophie are trying to come to terms with an uncertain future. Terry puts his emergency plan into action - but it will help only one of them. Comedy, starring Mackenzie Crook and Toby Jones

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories, presented by Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: The Holy Land and Us: Our Untold Stories
programme.desc: Two-part documentary in which co-presenters Rob Rinder and Sarah Agha, along with others of Jewish and Palestinian heritage, explore how their families' histories were impacted by the founding of the state of Israel in 1948. They begin by meeting a father and son who follow in the footsteps of their ancestor, who became caught up in Israel's War of Independence, and a woman whose grandmother survived one of the most notorious episodes of the Nakba

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charlotte Smith discovers how cuts are affecting management of Dartmoor. She finds out how the major political parties are taking sides over to the right to camp debate, and catches up with author Guy Shrubsole to discover a rare rainforest in the UK. Matt Baker helps conservationists with a bird survey, Adam Henson visits an equine rehab centre, and Paralympian Sammi Kinghorn meets volunteers opening up Dartmoor for everyone. Plus, in the second of a four-part strand, Adrian Chiles discovers what it takes to be a hill farmer in Wales

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: A plastic-free soap brand hopes to clean up with potential investors Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Sara Davies and Steven Bartlett. Plus, the entrepreneurs behind mouldable fixing sticks claim they have found an alternative to glue, a 15-year-old enters the Den to help pitch a football board game and a micro-campervan business drives a hard bargain. Presented by Evan Davis

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Glassblower Alison from Buckinghamshire and upcycling couple Fernando and Saurabh from Berkshire visit Dom Chinea's life-changing training camp. Alison aspires to sell her pieces in high-end galleries, but mentor Allister knows standards are high and getting her work into them won't be easy. He focuses on the details of Alison's pieces and pushes her hard to improve them. Fernando and Saurabh want to turn their upcycling hobby into a full-time business. Mentor Joel gives them tough feedback about concentrating on every aspect of their work and the importance of a good website

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Walks of Life
programme.desc: JB Gill explores the county of Cornwall to find out how the dramatic landscape shapes the lives and beliefs of the people who live there

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp and Phil Serrell go shopping for items of interest in Northern Ireland. Natasha is dazzled by the sight of a bright pink Majolica lotus pattern tea service and the sounds of the Irish fiddle. She even gets a mini masterclass on how to play this centuries-old instrument of the Emerald Isle. Philip is feeling the pinch and is desperate to find some profit-making antiques. He scoops up an old bowler hat, a pair of early dumbbells and a mid-19th-century worktable that reminds him of his grandmother. The duo later head to their final auction in Wales, where an unexpected bidding frenzy ensues

programme.title: Secrets of the Jurassic Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Part one of two. Liz Bonnin joins an international team of palaeontologists in the remote badlands of Wyoming as they investigate a mysterious dinosaur graveyard. Packed with over a dozen skeletons including predators such as the fearsome Allosaurus and giants like Diplodocus, as well as fossilised plants and footprints, the site is a treasure trove that is helping to change the way the Jurassic era is seen. The evidence also helps the team to answer why so many dinosaurs came here, and what killed them in such great numbers 150 million years ago

programme.desc: Tanya Arnold introduces action from the latest fixtures, including Huddersfield Giants v Wigan Warriors, Warrington Wolves v Leigh Leopards and St Helens v Hull FC

programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Eggheads

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore food-related customs associated with wedding ceremonies. The duo help prepare a Scottish breakfast fit for a bride and groom, and highlight traditions behind the star of the nuptial feast - the cake

programme.title: Eat Well for Less?
programme.desc: Jordan Banjo and Chris Bavin advise a family from West Drayton, west London. Liston, Preety and their children Teyha, Jorja and Dylan love a takeaway and need to cut down on their snacking. Fast food and sugary snacks aren't great, but for Preety it's more serious than normal as she has diabetes. It's a condition that runs in the family and she is concerned that the children don't follow in her footsteps. Chris shows them a tasty and nutritious meal using ingredients from their pantry. Jordan is on a mission to get the kids eating more veg and hopes his 'rainbow' pizza will convince them

programme.title: The World's Most Extraordinary Homes
programme.desc: Caroline Quentin and architect Piers Taylor travel to Switzerland in search of four extraordinary homes. They begin their journey in a tiny hamlet called Jeurs and visit a four-bedroom house, before travelling to Brissago to see a property with views across Lake Maggiore. Next, the pair head to a remarkable S-shaped home outside of Zurich, before reaching the final house overlooking Lake Lucerne

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Mark Stacey and Michael Baggott assess items brought into Newby Hall in North Yorkshire. Mark comes across an interesting Clarice Cliff cake plate and Michael enjoys an ancient Chinese urn. Presenter Paul Martin takes in the splendours of the country house's Adams interiors

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall, Jodie Kidd, Jamali Maddix and Suzi Perry test their general knowledge in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher explores the food festival at Llangollen, where local food experts reveal their passion for their produce. Onkar Singh Purewal discovers how it is possible to grow tea in the Vale of Glamorgan and farmer Meinir Howells reveals just why Welsh lamb is so popular. She also discovers the secrets of an ice cream producer in Swansea

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Angela Scanlon presents the property makeover show in which cutting-edge virtual reality and visual effects enable people to see what their home could look like, before it is built in reality. Architects Laura Jane Clark and Julian McIntosh compete to remodel Shelley and Steven's three-bedroom semi-detached home in Bromley, south-east London

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs from the Central England region serve up their canapes, starters and fish dishes on an animation and illustration theme. Their vegan starters include a yellow beetroot Pac-Man and a 'Dragon's Egg' in homage to the Dragonology book series. The fish course includes two dishes in tribute to Raymond Briggs's Bogeyman and a Pingu mackerel, while the final chef serves up a hake inspired by Konky the Cat

programme.title: The Holy Land and Us: Our Untold Stories
programme.desc: Rob Rinder and Sarah Agha conclude their investigation into how their own and other families' histories were impacted by the founding of the state of Israel in 1948. They are joined by a woman who wants to find out why, when she was a child, her aunts left Egypt for the new state of Israel, and a woman who wants to know what happened to her family as her grandfather struggled to hold on to his land and orange groves in Jaffa

programme.title: QI XS
programme.desc: A selection of classic pieces of general ignorance from the comedy panel game. Hosted by Sandi Toksvig, with regular panellist Alan Davies and guests

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Murder in the Pacific
programme.desc: The bomber reveals how he came to plant the explosives on the Greenpeace ship Rainbow Warrior, and the measures he took to escape New Zealand after the attack. He and another suspect reveal the origins of the mission - the French government convincing them that the KGB had infiltrated Greenpeace

programme.title: Dave
programme.desc: A professional setback forces Dave to spend more time with his parents, and family time has never been more eye-opening

programme.title: Dave
programme.desc: Hoping to break through his creative block, Dave travels to a legendary recording studio, but is forced to confront his greatest obstacle - his own ego

programme.title: Great Australian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his exploration of southeast Australia in Melbourne, Victoria, where he visits a home in the suburbs of Lilydale that once belonged to Dame Nellie Melba. Later, he travels through the rainforest of the Dandenong mountains across a spectacular trestle bridge, before reaching St Kilda, where he enjoys a special screening of a feature film that explores the exploits of the notorious outlaw, Ned Kelly

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Angela Rippon and Julia Somerville report on the case of a phoney travel agent who ripped off hundreds of customers and left some stranded abroad. Plus, the woman whose home was fraudulently posted on one of the world's largest accommodation sites - and had would-be guests turning up on her doorstep from all over the world

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Dom Chinea welcomes digital artist and painter Tasia and stone-carver Alex into his Makers' Marquee. Tasia wants to give up her part-time job in retail to focus on her art full-time. Mentor Sharon is impressed with her digital art and sees potential in her painting, but wants her to produce a themed collection to help attract more buyers. Alex has a confidence problem, so mentor Louis packs him off to a market to help improve his selling skills

programme.title: Take a Hike

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: In the final instalment of their culinary journey through the history of British cuisine, Si King and Dave Myers explore comfort food, discussing how certain ingredients and recipes can give people a sense of well-being, such as chicken noodle soup and a simple fish dish

programme.title: Eat Well for Less?
programme.desc: Jordan Banjo and Chris Bavin head to Suffolk to advise a family divided at dinner time. Katy is acting mother to her late daughter's children, 10-year-old Ruby and eight-year-old Toby. All have very different tastes, which is a constant battle for Katy in her bid to unite them on single meals. Ruby eats most things but doesn't like fruit, whereas Toby does like fruit but hates vegetables. Katy herself has gluten and dairy intolerances. Chris and Jordan analyse the kitchen, replacing their usual choices with mainly cheaper brands disguised in plain packaging and also set a fruit and veg eating challenge

programme.title: The World's Most Extraordinary Homes
programme.desc: Piers Taylor and Caroline Quentin head to Japan, where they discover four extraordinary homes, built with great craftsmanship, combining high tech and a deep respect for tradition. Properties include the 'Glass House for a Diver' on the coast at Etajima, an all-glass building inspired by the chambers of an ants' nest, with rough concrete blocks chosen to surround the delicate home

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: At Dover Castle in Kent, Jonathan Pratt and James Lewis scour the crowd to find objects to take off to auction. Jonathan discovers an elegant Lalique figure and James finds a pristine collection of Chinese snuff bottles. Presenter Paul Martin uncovers the murderous history of the castle

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall, Jodie Kidd, Jamali Maddix and Suzi Perry test their general knowledge in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Colin Murray and Edith Bowman reveal the secrets of farmers and food producers at the Peebles Show, where they discover tips and treats from passionate food producers, from perfect steaks to creating premium chocolate at a fraction of the price. Farmer Jim Smith is near Inverness discovering the story behind every bag of carrots and chef Julie Lin investigates what people are missing out on when it comes to mackerel

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Architects Will Foster and Lynsey Elliott compete to remodel a home in Gosport, Hampshire, that holds 20 years of family memories and a lifetime of antiques and heirlooms for soon-to-be grandparents Lisa and Judy. Angela Scanlon presents

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs from the Central England region serve up their mains and desserts, competing for a place at a banquet celebrating animation and illustration. Their creative offerings include a Desperate Dan pie, a traditional Staffordshire stew, a homage to Zebedee from The Magic Roundabout, with a spring made of spun sugar, and a Bananaman dessert

programme.title: Saving Lives in Leeds
programme.desc: Leeds General Infirmary plastic surgeon Chris West's patients today include 67-year-old Trevor, who needs surgery to remove small bits of tumour left behind from a previous operation. But Trevor suffers from anxiety and the stress of waiting is making his condition worse, so before long he tries to leave. Meanwhile, neurosurgeon Kenan Deniz operates on a tumour growing deep behind a patient's ear, which if not removed could paralyse her face

programme.title: The Cockfields
programme.desc: Simon is persuaded to mark the occasion of his 40th birthday back at the Cockfield family home, so takes his girlfriend Donna along to the Isle of Wight. The duo soon find themselves spending a long weekend as guests of his ever-doting mother Sue and controlling stepfather Ray, together with their menagerie of relatives and friends. Comedy, starring Joe Wilkinson, Diane Morgan, Sue Johnston and Bobby Ball

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Radioactive (2019)
programme.desc: Pole Marie Sklodowska emigrates to France where she meets and marries fellow scientist Pierre Curie, and they start to collaborate - resulting in them receiving a Nobel Prize. Growing doubts over the safety of radium casts a shadow over their research, but even after Pierre's death, Marie is determined to carry on. Biopic of Marie Curie, starring Rosamund Pike, with Sam Riley

programme.title: Saved and Remade
programme.desc: The transformation of a beloved car leaves its owner astounded, and a pair of ballet shoes are given a new lease of life. Hosted by Sabrina Grant

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: A look at how one switch of the visa rules left many with their trips hanging in the balance, and the holidaymakers refused travel when their passports were perfectly valid. Plus, Simon Calder shares his best budget breaks

programme.title: Amanda & Alan's Italian Job
programme.desc: Alan takes charge designing the first bedroom, but doubt soon sets in as Amanda and Scott struggle to get on board with his artistic vision. To nail his 'rustic chic' look, Alan visits interior designer Marie at her 300-year-old palazzo and ropes in Amanda to help source vintage gems at Palermo's famous flea market. Later, Amanda surprises Alan with a birthday boat trip along Sicily's stunning Zingaro coast

programme.title: Scarlett's Driving School
programme.desc: Builder Garry has been learning to drive for 30 years and relied on wife Jeany to take him everywhere, but after she had an accident he now needs to pass to help her. Garry's battle is even tougher as his dyslexia makes following signs difficult, but Jeany is there with constant advice. During their five days at Scarlett's Driving School, there are near-misses on roundabouts and marital squabbles

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's exploration of the West Country continues in south Devon. He arrives in Paignton to investigate an extraordinarily high murder rate in the literature of the 1930s. The Dartmouth Steam Railway conveys him in style to the beautiful home of Agatha Christie, in the company of her great-grandson, James Prichard

programme.title: The Flying Archaeologist
programme.desc: Ben Robinson flies over Wiltshire to uncover new discoveries in the Stone Age landscape of Stonehenge. Sites found from the air have led to exciting evidence that helps to explain why the monument's location was chosen and reveals at what point in history it was inhabited

programme.title: Archaeology: A Secret History
programme.desc: Richard Miles concludes his series charting the history of archaeological breakthroughs by discovering more about the ancient common man. The investigation takes the archaeologist from the elaborate grave of Egyptian boy king Tutankhamun to the Danish resting place of the Tollund Man, who died as part of an Iron Age sacrifice more than 2,000 years ago

programme.title: Britain's Lost Masterpieces
programme.desc: Art experts Jacky Klein and Dr Bendor Grosvenor visit museums as they track down previously unknown paintings by some of the world's greatest artists. In the first edition, the pair head to a museum store in Swansea, where they reveal a multi-million pound lost masterpiece with the potential to rewrite art history. Plus, Jacky is prompted to re-examine the life of renowned Polish artist Josef Herman, who created a giant painting of local coal miners

programme.title: The Rise of the Murdoch Dynasty
programme.desc: A huge scandal threatens Rupert's dream of passing on the family business to one of his children, resulting in 'the most humble day' of his life. In response to the revelations, the Murdoch Empire goes on the offensive and the alliance against him come under sustained pressure, but whistle-blowers begin to emerge, then a bombshell revelation completely changes public opinion. A sequence of disastrous events leaves Murdoch's business plans in ruins, and he closes the News of the World newspaper

programme.title: Sword, Musket & Machine Gun: Britain's Armed History
programme.desc: Sam Willis traces the evolution of weaponry in Britain, beginning by getting to grips with the swords, lances and shields used on the battlefield 1,000 years ago

programme.title: Archaeology: A Secret History
programme.desc: Richard Miles concludes his series charting the history of archaeological breakthroughs by discovering more about the ancient common man. The investigation takes the archaeologist from the elaborate grave of Egyptian boy king Tutankhamun to the Danish resting place of the Tollund Man, who died as part of an Iron Age sacrifice more than 2,000 years ago

A sequence of disastrous events leaves Murdoch's business plans in ruins, and he closes the News of the World newspaper

programme.title: Britain's Lost Masterpieces
programme.desc: Art experts Jacky Klein and Dr Bendor Grosvenor visit museums as they track down previously unknown paintings by some of the world's greatest artists. In the first edition, the pair head to a museum store in Swansea, where they reveal a multi-million pound lost masterpiece with the potential to rewrite art history. Plus, Jacky is prompted to re-examine the life of renowned Polish artist Josef Herman, who created a giant painting of local coal miners

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo crosses the county line from Devon into Somerset, seeing first-hand how willow farmers sought to overcome the challenge from the production of synthetic plastics during the 1930s and hearing how tourism has spread across the region, especially amongst the young. In Bath, Michael visits the former home of a refugee emperor, whose country was invaded by the Italian dictator Mussolini, and in whose name a religious movement began that now flourishes worldwide. Travelling east into Wiltshire, he reaches the largest training area of the British Army, Salisbury Plain

programme.title: The Flying Archaeologist
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson flies over the Norfolk Broads where aerial photographs have discovered 945 previously unknown ancient sites, many of which are making historians rethink the area. The fate of the Roman town of Caistor St Edmund has puzzled archaeologists for decades. It has long been a mystery why the centre never became a modern town. Now archaeologists have discovered a key piece of evidence. And near Ormesby the first proof of Bronze Age settlement in the East of England has been revealed

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Judith suddenly becomes impressed by Lionel, while Alistair tries to woo Jean with a band and a gorillagram. Comedy, starring Judi Dench

programme.title: The Mistress
programme.desc: Luke realises the only way he can heal the breach with Maxine is by spending a Sunday together. She, however, has other plans. Carla Lane's love triangle comedy, starring Felicity Kendal, Peter McEnery and Jane Asher. From 1987

programme.title: A History of Britain by Simon Schama
programme.desc: Simon Schama continues his journey through British history, discovering how the expansion of imperialism was built on the Empire's slave trade and relied on the subjugation of native peoples to enrich the mother country. This was despite Britons' natural distrust of large armies and all-powerful governments

programme.title: Timewatch
programme.desc: Geologist Simon Haslett and tsunami expert Ted Bryant reveal the devastation caused to Britain when a 12m-high wall of water hit an area near Bristol in 1607 and claimed 2,000 lives. It crashed ashore with such ferocity that the geography of the coastline was altered for ever, yet despite being chronicled by eyewitnesses, the country's worst natural disaster has been forgotten with time

programme.title: Climbing Blind
programme.desc: Documentary about Jesse Dufton and his attempt to take on the challenge of becoming the first blind person to lead a climb of the Old Man of Hoy in Orkney, Scotland. At four years of age, Jesse was diagnosed with retinitis pigmentosa, a rare genetic disease that breaks down the retina's cells. When he was 20, Jesse could no longer read. By the time he was 30, he could only detect light, with around a one to two per cent field of view. As a lifelong climber, what Jesse has achieved flies in the face of adversity, training for world cup events and leading traditional rock climbs with his sight guide and fiancee Molly. Now, his attempt on the Old Man of Hoy is testimony to his ambition to take on new and greater challenges, despite his devastating condition

programme.title: How to Make
programme.desc: Designer and materials engineer Zoe Laughlin dismantles and dissects three classic items to understand the wonders of form, function and material that go into making them, before building her own truly bespoke versions step by step. Here she makes modern classic the training shoe, meeting some of the UK's leading designers and manufacturers, as well as young inventors working on sustainable creations such as material made by bacteria and self-deodorising fabrics

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo crosses the county line from Devon into Somerset, seeing first-hand how willow farmers sought to overcome the challenge from the production of synthetic plastics during the 1930s and hearing how tourism has spread across the region, especially amongst the young. programme.title: A History of Britain by Simon Schama
programme.desc: Simon Schama continues his journey through British history, discovering how the expansion of imperialism was built on the Empire's slave trade and relied on the subjugation of native peoples to enrich the mother country. This was despite Britons' natural distrust of large armies and all-powerful governments

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores the east of England in the inter-war period, starting in Canterbury, Kent, where he treads the boards as he uncovers the political message behind a 1936 play, inspired by the 12th-century murder of Archbishop Thomas a Becket. In Maidstone, he learns of the international origins of the most British symbol of remembrance. Outside Sevenoaks, Michael visits the country home of Winston Churchill, and discovers how the 1930s were wilderness years at Chartwell, as Churchill warned against Nazi appeasement. Once in the capital, he heads to Alexandra Palace, the birthplace of television

programme.title: The Flying Archaeologist
programme.desc: Ben Robinson flies over Hadrian's Wall to reveal a new view of its history. The first full aerial survey of the construction has helped uncover new evidence about those who once resided there. Carried out over the past few years by English Heritage, it is allowing archaeologists to reinterpret the fortification as hundreds of sites of human occupation have been discovered, showing that people were living there in considerable numbers

programme.title: Chris Packham's Animal Einsteins
programme.desc: The presenter introduces animals that build structures and adapt the environment for their own benefit, creating safe places to sleep and raise young or traps to catch prey. The programme examines how the huge dams built by beavers can completely transform the surrounding landscape, the function of the different types of silk spiders are capable of producing, and how leafcutter ants build underground gardens where they farm their own food

programme.title: Six Wives with Lucy Worsley
programme.desc: The historian explores the fate of the last three wives of Henry VIII. First, Lucy witnesses Henry's doomed courtship with Anne of Cleves, with Henry successfully reneging on their marriage having claimed it had yet to be consummated. Two weeks later, Henry married teenager Catherine Howard, but an act of adultery with a courtier saw the young woman convicted of treason and beheaded. Finally, Lucy explores Henry's relationship with his last wife Katherine Parr, and how she managed to win Henry round despite their greatly differing religious beliefs

programme.title: The Six Wives of Henry VIII
programme.desc: Henry is in agony with his ulcerated leg. The Duke of Norfolk presents his young and pretty niece Catherine Howard to the king, who becomes captivated. Henry soon marries Catherine - but will she prove to be his rose without a thorn? Keith Michell and Angela Pleasence star. From 1970

programme.title: The Six Wives of Henry VIII
programme.desc: The year is 1543 and the king is grossly fat and semi-lame. Beset by boredom he longs for a new wife to ease his lonely life. Will the twice widowed and scholarly Katherine Parr fulfil his needs? Keith Michell and Rosalie Crutchley star in the historical drama. From 1970

No matter what moves they try, it all goes wrong - balls are dropped, catches are missed, and rules are ignored. In fact, every basketball competition rapidly descends into utter chaos. However, Dad just might have an idea to help give them the edge: a training bootcamp with the London Lions basketball team. Will this be enough for Omari and his younger siblings to snatch victory from Laquarn on the court.

programme.desc: Imagine removing all the colours one by one? It would change more than just how things look, and after taking out just three colours, we would not be able to see anything at all!

programme.title: My Life
programme.desc: Fourteen-year-olds Kyra and Sophie started rescuing hedgehogs in their Stratford-Upon-Avon home when they were just nine years old. They have now saved over 600 hedgehogs, rescuing, rehabilitating and then releasing them back into the wild. We meet Kyra and Sophie in their garden hospital, and follow the rescue, medical care, rehabilitation and release of some of the poorly hedgehogs that they have been looking after.

Now she embraces her beautiful bald look, but sometimes chooses to wear a wig. With the support of her twin brother and family we take a look into her life. programme.desc: Stacey is shocked to find out where Freddie is getting his money from and Lola worries Emma has rejected her again. Zack asks some important questions at the clinic but it might be too late for him and Whitney

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: The designers head to Scotland for their next challenge, making-over a hotel room at a five-star golf and spa resort with just two days and a budget of 2,000. Half of the competitors are given a brief for a maximalist design for the hotel's more outdoorsy guests, while the others must create a tranquil space for those looking for a relaxing spa visit. With a double elimination looming, the designers pull out all the tricks they have up their sleeves to impress Alan, Michelle and guest judge Matthew Williamson

programme.title: Anton & Giovanni's Adventures in Sicily
programme.desc: Strictly Come Dancing stars Anton Du Beke and Giovanni Pernice embark on a tour of Giovanni's homeland Sicily, beginning in the port town of Sciacca. Their first stop is the Valley of the Temples, the remains of a huge Greek city featuring some of the best examples of classical Greek architecture anywhere in the world. From there, they hit the white beaches of Porta Bianca before taking in some more history in Syracuse. Today, it is just a provincial city, but more than 2,700 years ago it was one of the largest colonies in the ancient Greek world, and some of the original buildings remain inside the city's Archaeological Park. Their final stop is the island's second city Catania, a place very significant to Giovanni as he moved there aged 14 to further his dance career

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Dark Land: Hunting the Killers
programme.desc: The team re-examines the case of Suzanne Greenhill, a 20-year-old deaf woman from Newport. In 1988 Suzanne was found murdered at home, her body ghoulishly staged to represent the cover of an Iron Maiden heavy metal album cover. Detectives had to work closely with the deaf community to uncover the identity of Suzanne's killer, with pioneering forensic techniques called upon to secure a conviction. It has gone down in history as one of the most unique murder investigations in policing history

programme.title: Official Secrets (2019)
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about the publication of a leaked GCHQ memo in the run-up to the Iraq war. The film reveals the devastating consequences for whistleblower Katharine Gun, who was put on trial for breaching the Official Secrets Act, and the journalists who were determined to unmask a conspiracy. Keira Knightley and Matt Smith star

programme.title: The Repair Shop

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: Five teams race 16,000 kilometres across the breadth of Canada starting from Vancouver on the Pacific coastline and passing through seven checkpoints before reaching St Johns on the island of Newfoundland, the most easterly town in North America. Their skill, ingenuity and determination are put to the test as they embark on their journey without access to smartphones, the internet or credit cards. Armed with only the cash equivalent of the airfare to fly their route, the teams travel at ground level through some of the most remote regions in the world

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Rivers
programme.desc: Paul Murton explores the lower reaches of Royal Deeside. Heading downstream, he runs aground in a canoe and then gets stuck trying to thread his body through an ancient fertility stone. In Aberdeen, he learns a secret recipe for the city's famous rowie - a Caledonian version of the croissant. Journey's end is on the city's famous golden sands

programme.title: The Gold: The Inside Story
programme.desc: The true story of Britain's biggest bullion heist, featuring the personal accounts of the police officers who investigated the 1983 robbery at the Brink's-Mat security depot. Speaking for the first time since the robbery, Detective Chief Superintendent Brian Boyce and DC Tony Yeoman reveal the challenges they faced, the strategy they took and the tragedy that unfolded as they staked out Kenneth Noye, one of the men at the epicentre of the gang transforming the gold into cash

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Alan Yentob joins director Stephen Frears on the Vienna set of forthcoming drama The Palace, and looks back his career while exploring the city. Frears looks back on his breakthrough in the theatre, at the Royal Court in London in the early 1960s, through BBC's Play for Today to his movie breakthrough with My Beautiful Laundrette and Dangerous Liaisons. With contributions from Hugh Grant, Judi Dench, Steve Coogan, Hanif Kureishi, Glenn Close, John Malkovich, Jack Black, Helen Mirren and Meryl Streep

programme.title: Philomena (2013)
programme.desc: A teenager in 1950s Ireland becomes pregnant, and is sent to a home for 'fallen women', while her baby is forcibly taken from her and sent to America to be adopted. Fifty years later, she meets a disillusioned political journalist who attempts to reunite her with her son. Fact-based drama, starring Judi Dench and Steve Coogan

Their first stop is the Valley of the Temples, the remains of a huge Greek city featuring some of the best examples of classical Greek architecture anywhere in the world. From there, they hit the white beaches of Porta Bianca before taking in some more history in Syracuse. Today, it is just a provincial city, but more than 2,700 years ago it was one of the largest colonies in the ancient Greek world, and some of the original buildings remain inside the city's Archaeological Park. Their final stop is the island's second city Catania, a place very significant to Giovanni as he moved there aged 14 to further his dance career

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Spotlight
programme.desc: Jennifer O'Leary presents an interview claiming to reveal secrets of the peace process

programme.title: Official Secrets (2019)
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about the publication of a leaked GCHQ memo in the run-up to the Iraq war. The film reveals the devastating consequences for whistleblower Katharine Gun, who was put on trial for breaching the Official Secrets Act, and the journalists who were determined to unmask a conspiracy. Keira Knightley and Matt Smith star

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead

programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Crimewatch Live
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and Michelle Ackerley appeal for information from the public about crimes around the country

programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: A police car in North Yorkshire take a hit when a car thief is desperate to escape and a paramedic uses her experience with her own mental health issues to help others. The West Midlands Drone Unit demonstrates the essential part their high-tech equipment plays in today's policing

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell follow the development progress of a bungalow in Derbyshire, a three-bedroom semi in Burton-on-Trent and a Staffordshire property

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross and experts Thomas Forrester and Stephanie Connell go antique hunting in Brackley, Northamptonshire, before heading to Stratford-upon-Avon for the latest auction. Charlie is also going all to pot as he discovers the canal communities favourite type of earthenware

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: The peer reviews left things frosty between the staff and Kirsty deals with Ollie's unwelcome surprise. Ruhma's colleague delivers her 5,000th birth but things don't go to plan

programme.title: Jay and Dom's Home Fix
programme.desc: Jay Blades and Dominic Chinea's imaginations are put to the test when they make different versions of children's furniture. The duo also revamp an old lampshade and make a simple key holder. Plus, from the archives, Alan Titchmarsh returfs a lawn, and Joe Swift and Carol Klein reveal their favourite tools for gardening

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps a young animal loving couple who have a budget of 750,000 search for a new home in Norfolk

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Irita Marriott and Phil Serrell reach Yorkshire, where dedicated follower of fashion Irita finds out about haute couture, 1890s Hull-style, while Phil is turned into a pumpkin

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Ross Kemp hosts the game show, challenging friends Louise, Glen, Laura and Jack to find a safe path across the bridge, choosing the truths and avoiding the lies

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Magazine show, with stories of interest from around the UK, plus celebrity guests in the studio

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Whitney and Zack agree to talk about their issues. Meanwhile, Denise and Jack find themselves in a tough situation on family games night. Stacey is relieved to have the cash to pay off the loan shark but when they demand more on short notice she has a tough decision to make

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team restore a painting belonging to a Ukrainian family who risked everything to conserve their family history, and a 1963 calendar from Liverpool's Cavern Club that was used to book The Beatles. Also brought into the shop is an 18ft homemade kayak and a leather swivel chair that evokes precious memories of a beloved father and grandfather

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: Five teams race 16,000 kilometres across the breadth of Canada starting from Vancouver on the Pacific coastline and passing through seven checkpoints before reaching St Johns on the island of Newfoundland, the most easterly town in North America. Their skill, ingenuity and determination are put to the test as they embark on their journey without access to smartphones, the internet or credit cards. Armed with only the cash equivalent of the airfare to fly their route, the teams travel at ground level through some of the most remote regions in the world

programme.desc: Nuair a tha an seladair, Mac Naoimhein, a' dol air chall, tha Tintin, Dleas agus na lorgairean a' dol a shireadh fhreagairtean. Tha tiona carr-crbaig annasach, falamh gan tarraing gu bta-carago leis an ainm Karaboudjan. When sailor Mac Naoimhein goes missing, Tintin, Dleas and the detectives go in search of answers. An empty tin of crab meat draws them to a cargo ship called the Karaboudjan.

He also goes in search of the Eriskay ponies and is back out at sea again to get as close to the wreck of the SS Politician as he can

programme.title: Clann Na Cruinne
programme.desc: Uros and his grandfather look after Geile, a seagull who needs their help until she is ready for her first flight and a return to the wild. He is hopeful that she will fit in with the other seagulls
An insight into Niall Iain Macdonald's life at 12 years old

programme.title: Geamaichean Gorach
programme.desc: Everyone is excited about the start of the imminent New Year and Coinneach is trying to spoil everything, as usual - but he won't get away with his scandalous behaviour

programme.title: Proiseact Ploigh
programme.desc: Featuring contributions from expert Dr Anna Roberts, gag gangs from Cumbernauld, Harris and Tain, with features on hearing, underwater volcano and a lemon battery

programme.title: Turas a' Bhradain
programme.desc: Neen MacKay explores Scotland's fishing rivers, focusing on the nation's hydro river systems, which are respected the world over

programme.desc: Iagan MacNeil crosses the border into England, visits College Valley - where he hears about the Collingwood Oaks - and finds out more about the Anglo-Saxon site of Ad Gefrin

programme.title: Sar Sgeoil
programme.desc: Cathy MacDonald explores the themes of George Mackay Brown's most popular novel, Greenvoe, which imagined an Orkney island community, Hellya, based on Stromness, being threatened by a mysterious defence project that would tear the island apart

programme.title: Trusadh (Compelling Stories)
programme.desc: Stories about poaching across the Highlands and Islands of Scotland, told by charismatic local storytellers, including anecdotes of poachers throughout the generations

programme.title: Machair
programme.desc: Gaelic soap based on the Isle of Lewis

programme.title: Dn
programme.desc: Ross Christie talks about how he came across the work of little-known poet Katharine Whyte Grant from Argyll. He reads her poem Blith-Fhleasg o Mhd nam Maca-Meamna

programme.title: Alleluia! (Spiritual Music & Verse)
programme.desc: Hymns, psalms and personal faith stories. James Graham and Kim Carnie sing Fa Chomhair Cathair Dh gu h-rd, and Mairi Rodgers explains the role of faith in her life

programme.desc: BBC Alba joins Radio nan Gidheal, the BBC's Gaelic language radio service

programme.title: Bing

programme.title: Nannag a' Noo/Huggleboo

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Ranjeev, Netrice, Linda and Ian pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. programme.title: DNA Journey
programme.desc: Line of Duty co-stars and lifelong friends Neil Morrissey and Adrian Dunbar embark on a journey across UK and Ireland to explore their family histories. Neil was taken into care when he was just 10 years old, and feels utterly disconnected from his family history. Desperate to fill in the gaps, he has enlisted Adrian to support him on what they both know will be a deeply emotional journey. In Castlecomer in southern Ireland, Neil reconnects with his cousin Marilyn. A performer like himself, she is finally able to give him the family folklore he craves. Meanwhile, a DNA test reveals some shocking news for Adrian, before he hears about the heart-breaking struggles his grandmother faced

Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Beth and Karen hunt for a hit-and-run motorcyclist after finding an old man lying injured by the road _ but are they on the right track? Joe reacts badly to Tom's admission about the true nature of his relationship with Beth and the men of Skelthwaite set out to make the perfect curry, but find they can't manage without the culinary expertise of eight-year-old Molly. Drama, starring Kerrie Taylor and Julian Lewis-Jones

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Anna tries to help new factory worker Linda Sargent, a single mother afraid she'll lose custody of her five children if it becomes known that she has Parkinson's disease. Meanwhile, Beth agonises over whether to accept the offer of a job in Holland, uncertain of how such a drastic move would affect her relationship with Tom - and paradoxically, it takes a rugby match to help her decide. Lesley Dunlop, Leslie Ash and Philip Middlemiss star

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A wealthy banker goes missing while walking from his country house to the village post office. Poirot, who has acquired a parrot and developed a taste for conjuring tricks, bets the baffled Inspector Japp 5 he can solve the mystery without leaving his own apartment. David Suchet stars

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick is busy honeymooning with Jo and in his absence Aidensfield is transformed from a sleepy rural retreat into a scene of mayhem and violence. A pair of armed robbers disguised as hippies take Greengrass hostage during a payroll heist and shoot his beloved dog. Despite the best efforts of new constable Mike Bradley, the villains make their getaway - and Blaketon's heroic intervention causes him to collapse with a heart attack

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Debbie's matchmaking attempts lead to disaster as all three get covered in mud, the car keys are lost and they find themselves stranded on the moors

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Ciaran McCarthy, an old friend of Peter's from his days in the Navy, comes into town, while Maria sells off all her possessions before her departure for Canada

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Audrey discovers Nick already has a girlfriend. Ciaran wastes no time in charming the locals and Ken gets stuck into his first assignment as a romantic fiction writer

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Scott investigate crime and mayhem in the countryside as they take on a murder case in picturesque Fletcher's Cross. Undertaker Patrick Pennyman is found dead in his funeral parlour and the detectives suspect a possible link to the local spiritualist church. When another body turns up, the pressure to find the culprit redoubles. John Nettles, John Hopkins and Jane Wymark star

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Oscar-winning actress Shirley MacLaine joins the cast of the period drama as Cora's mother Martha, who makes a grand entrance when she arrives at Downton for Matthew and Mary's wedding. However, with the couple struggling to stay united as their big day looms, will Martha's Atlantic crossing have been for nothing? Meanwhile, Mr Carson runs the rule over new footman Alfred, and Robert receives news that could leave him facing the greatest crisis of his life - and plunge the rest of the household into chaos. Starring Hugh Bonneville, Maggie Smith, Jim Carter and Michelle Dockery

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The Deightons, a family of crooked travellers, pitches camp in Aidensfield, and it is not long before its members are plotting to steal Greengrass's new horse and even kidnapping Ventress. With Nick still away on honeymoon, it is up to PCs Bellamy and Bradley to bring the rogues to justice. Bill Maynard and Derek Fowlds star

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Scott investigate the death of a racehorse trainer and suspect an aristocratic family's troubled history holds the key to the mystery - until a second killing makes them think again. Groom Jake Foley seems the obvious suspect, but as events unfold, the detectives' inquiries gradually focus instead on the residents of stately Bantling Hall. Detective drama, starring John Nettles

programme.title: Blue Murder
programme.desc: With just 48 hours to crack the case, Janine's professional future looks bleak and her domestic situation continues to deteriorate. With ex-husband Pete's bitter accusations of neglect ringing in her ears, the troubled DCI visits Lesley Tulley to inform her that Dean Hendrix has been arrested for the crime - but a phone call from Richard leads to the chilling realisation that her own life is in danger. Conclusion of the two-part crime drama, starring Caroline Quentin, Ian Kelsey, David Schofield and Rachel Grant

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: An ancient Cornish folk ritual ends in the murder of a local undertaker - and provides quick-witted copper Charles Wycliffe with one of the most baffling mysteries of his career. Jack Shepherd, Helen Masters, Jimmy Yuill and Susan Penhaligon star

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Beth and Karen hunt for a hit-and-run motorcyclist after finding an old man lying injured by the road _ but are they on the right track? Joe reacts badly to Tom's admission about the true nature of his relationship with Beth and the men of Skelthwaite set out to make the perfect curry, but find they can't manage without the culinary expertise of eight-year-old Molly. Drama, starring Kerrie Taylor and Julian Lewis-Jones

programme.title: Man About the House
programme.desc: Chrissy and Robin borrow Mr Roper's car to drive to Southampton for a football match. However, the vehicle has similar qualities to its unreliable owner and soon breaks down leaving the duo having to summon help from an unexpected quarter. Comedy, with Richard O'Sullivan and Paula Wilcox

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Charity makes excuses when Terry arrives to pick her up and finds Cain stayed the night in the hotel too. Meanwhile, Steph takes advantage of Alan

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: A drunken Diane agrees to a lock-in, until the police show up. Alan demands Steph return the beauty supplies, and Nicola finds reason to celebrate

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: After a successful day out, Kevin misreads the signals and moves in to kiss Sally. Les considers how to get hold of old coins for the Rovers' theme night

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Fiz refuses to make way for Maria, the Websters iron out their differences and Fred introduces Mike to Doreen, thrilled to find the pair get on like a house on fire

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Scott investigate when ladies' man and rowing club member Guy Sweetman is found dead in the river during the annual Midsomer Regatta. They soon discover the elite exterior of the club hides a world of money problems and sexual jealousy and the victim had a number of enemies who might have wanted him dead. Guest starring Olympic rower Steve Redgrave and Diana Quick

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: With the estate's future hanging in the balance, Mary hopes to receive a bailout from her grandmother Martha - and with Violet's help, tries to make sure Downton puts on a bigger show than ever before with a grand party for friends and neighbours. Meanwhile, Mrs Hughes hears worrying news, and O'Brien's efforts to boost Alfred's progress meets with disapproval from Thomas. Costume drama, starring Michelle Dockery, Shirley MacLaine and Maggie Smith

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick moves up a rank to Sergeant and Blaketon becomes the new postmaster, while Greengrass threatens revenge on the miscreant responsible for dosing his beloved dog Alfred with rat poison. Rural drama, starring Nick Berry and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Hathaway and Lewis struggle to determine whether a death during a college-based clinical trial for a new antidepressant was murder or suicide, and receive little assistance from the institution's evasive psychiatric professor. A second student's demise then leads to the revelation that the trial's participants are all operating under the influence of a mind-altering drug, and that the lines between love, obsession and madness have become dangerously blurred. Guest starring Douglas Henshall (Primeval), Lucy Liemann (Rev) and Thomas Brodie Sangster (Love Actually)

programme.title: Blue Murder
programme.desc: Detective and single mother Janine Lewis fears she will struggle to balance her responsibilities as she returns to work following maternity leave. However, she soon gets back into the swing of things as she investigates the murder of a lap-dancer - who just happened to work for a man involved in a hit-and-run accident. Ian Kelsey co-stars

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: The discovery of a body at a ramshackle farm alerts Wycliffe to the fact that a murderer is at large in a sleepy Cornish village - and when two locals disappear, he realises it will take all his deductive powers to solve the mystery. Whodunit, starring Jack Shepherd and Helen Masters

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: A new family arrives in Skelthwaite, putting Anna's nose out of joint. David is shocked when Karen is contacted by a figure from the past, and a fund-raising idea is put in motion
