programme.desc: Alan inspires a gloomy Steph, Marlon vows to help Sam pass his driving test and Scott's guilty conscience troubles him

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Steph sees Rodney in a new light and ends up making him an offer he cannot refuse. Meanwhile, Scott is disappointed by Chloe

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Audrey catches Nick and Maria together, and Sally finally gives in and agrees to let Kevin move back home

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Norris's finest moment at the Commonwealth Games is lost in time as Emily fails to capture it on video, and Nick tells Maria how he really feels about her

programme.title: Man About the House
programme.desc: Chrissy takes over Robin's poker game when he is rushed into hospital. Unfortunately, she does not fully understand the rules and puts the rent money at risk. Comedy, with Paula Wilcox and Richard O'Sullivan

programme.title: Man About the House
programme.desc: Chrissy and Robin borrow Mr Roper's car to drive to Southampton for a football match. However, the vehicle has similar qualities to its unreliable owner and soon breaks down leaving the duo having to summon help from an unexpected quarter. Comedy, with Richard O'Sullivan and Paula Wilcox

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: The new head of the primary school upsets Beth by suggesting that a much-loved teacher's erratic behaviour may be down to a drinking problem, but when pupils are put at risk the nurse realises there could be an even more serious explanation. Meanwhile, the Scorpions face a difficult match and Anna fears she's jeopardised the factory's future when she gives an unhelpful bank manager a piece of her mind

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Anna faces every parent's worst nightmare as baby Amy is rushed to hospital with signs of meningitis and when the diagnosis is confirmed, panic sets in among the townsfolk. Anna keeps vigil by her daughter's side, while Luke plays truant from school, sending Karen on a desperate mission to find him. Beth and Tom give in to their feelings for each other

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A dentist falls in love with his young assistant. His anxious wife, believing he has made plans to poison her and thereby remove the main obstacle to happiness, calls for Poirot's help. Drama, starring David Suchet

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: As the day of his wedding finally arrives, Nick decides to avoid the hurly-burly of the police house by taking a soothing drive in the country - where he promptly gets involved in a domestic dispute and ends up stranded on the moors miles from anywhere

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Rodney throws a party to celebrate his engagement. Cain decides on a location for his family trip

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Steph realises Rodney is penniless and takes off. Charity struggles to hide her feelings when Cain reveals where they are going

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Nick makes a tearful Maria a tempting offer before he flies home to Canada, Geena's unprofessional attitude leaves Shelley fuming

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Shelley is left in the lurch when Geena resigns, Ken gets an intriguing offer, and Toyah cannot believe that Maria has accepted Nick's proposal

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth is asked to investigate the disappearance of a bank's most valued customer, who had been planning to sell the chairman a map showing where to find a long-lost silver mine. David Suchet stars

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: The residents celebrate Christmas 1919 with a lavish party, but tensions are rife and Bates's arrest casts a shadow over the festivities. Mary has to consider her future with Sir Richard Carlisle following a disagreement at a shoot and Violet has concerns about Rosamund, whose new suitor - the dashing but raffish Lord Hepworth - is not all he seems. One-off festive special of the hit costume drama, guest starring Nigel Havers and Sharon Small, with Brendan Coyle, Michelle Dockery, Iain Glen, Maggie Smith and Samantha Bond

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick is busy honeymooning with Jo and in his absence Aidensfield is transformed from a sleepy rural retreat into a scene of mayhem and violence. A pair of armed robbers disguised as hippies take Greengrass hostage during a payroll heist and shoot his beloved dog. Despite the best efforts of new constable Mike Bradley, the villains make their getaway - and Blaketon's heroic intervention causes him to collapse with a heart attack

programme.title: McDonald & Dodds
programme.desc: Mystery drama set in Bath, where the wildly ambitious DCI McDonald finds herself paired with the shy, modest DS Dodds, who has languished on the shelf for most of his working life. However, it soon turns out the unassuming sergeant has a hidden talent for puzzle solving. Their first case sees the pair looking into the shooting of a homeless man in the deserted mansion of local industrialist Max Crockett. The Crockett appear to be a close-knit group but it soon becomes clear they have secrets to hide. Jason Watkins and Tala Gouveia star as the detectives, with a guest appearance from Robert Lindsay

programme.title: Blue Murder
programme.desc: First in a two-part crime drama, starring Caroline Quentin as detective and single mother Janine Lewis, who is forced to put her family concerns aside to investigate the murder of a deputy headmaster found disembowelled on his allotment. A number of suspects and witnesses are soon identified, but tension soon rises in the ranks and Lewis finds herself risking mutiny by the officers under her command. To make matters worse, her troublesome children prove a headache. With Ian Kelsey, David Schofield, Nicholas Murchie and Paul Loughran

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: The apparent suicide of an amateur flautist and the disappearance of a maid on a secluded country estate soon have Detective Superintendent Charles Wycliffe unravelling a mystery involving family feuds and illicit relationships. Police drama, starring Jack Shepherd, Helen Masters and Jimmy Yuill

programme.title: The Grand Fishing Adventure
programme.desc: Ali and Bobby head off on the final leg of their British Isles tour to a lake in Essex, where they fly fish for trout. programme.title: Speed (1994)
programme.desc: An LAPD cop discovers a psychotic criminal has planted a bomb on a crowded bus, primed to go off if the vehicle drops below 50mph. Action thriller, starring Keanu Reeves, Sandra Bullock, Dennis Hopper and Jeff Daniels

programme.desc: Observational documentary about Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe, the British-Iranian charity worker arrested at Tehran airport in 2016 and accused of spying. Her husband Richard juggled a media and political campaign to free his wife while raising their daughter Gabriella alone. He knew then that his wife's detention was deeply connected to the complicated and toxic diplomatic relationship between Britain and Iran and to an unpaid debt going back half a century. Five years in the making, this film includes never-before-seen material captured by Nazanin herself

programme.title: Building Britain's Canals
programme.desc: Dan Jones examines Britain's most iconic canals, beginning with the 152-mile Grand Union Canal, which runs up the spine of the country. Constructed at the height of the Industrial Revolution, the task challenged even the greatest engineering minds of the time, including pioneers such as James Brindley, the man behind Britain's first commercial canal, and William Jessop, the person with whom responsibility lay for the building of the main link from Birmingham to London. Travelling along its route, Dan experiences first-hand the innovations behind its construction, including the Blisworth tunnel

programme.desc: Ben heads back to Western Australia to revisit 69-year-old Barbara, a Swiss woman who has lived alone in an isolated Bush camp for 16 years, and he quickly learns that the past eight years have not been easy. He discovers that not only has his friend had to deal with a serious cancer scare, but she came close to losing everything in a devastating fire

programme.title: The Night Stalker: Terror in a Small Town
programme.desc: In 1996, women began to disappear off the streets of Claremont, sending shockwaves through the wealthy suburb of Perth and all of Australia. A community lived in fear and the perpetrator simply disappeared, leaving behind a chilling trail of rape and murder. It took more than 20 years and the assistance of FBI profilers and British forensic experts to uncover the identity of the killer, who was someone already in the system. Through the lens of the surviving victims, this documentary reveals how society can enable a serial killer to hide in plain sight - and the devastating legacy of a series of terrifying disappearances

programme.title: Born to Kill?
programme.desc: In the mid-1970s, London and the south-east of England saw a series of murders, the last of which was that of a Catholic priest found bludgeoned to death with an axe. The culprit was eventually found to be Patrick Mackay, who had been diagnosed at the age of 15 as being a potential psychopathic killer and whose behaviour became stranger and more extreme as he grew older. With the help of contributions from those who encountered him, psychologists and criminologists attempt to unravel whether Mackay was predisposed to become a murderer

programme.title: Tyrant: The Rise of Adolf Hitler
programme.desc: A radical re-telling of the events that lead to the Second World War, this time focusing on the period between September 1938 and March 1939. In September 1938, Hitler makes his intention to invade Czechoslovakia known, but Britain and France make it clear they will go to war against Germany if he does so. On the night of 9 November in Germany, Nazi forces attack Jewish property and homes, killing many Jews and arresting thousands more. Known as Kristallnacht, this was the start of the Holocaust, which exposed Hitler and his horrific plans on the world stage. Finally, this episode travels back to 15 March 1939, when Hitler's troops marched across the border and occupied Czechoslovakia

programme.title: Casualty 24/7: Every Second Counts
programme.desc: There are no available beds in Barnsley Hospital's A&E department, while lead nurse Kelly is struggling with a backlog of ambulances waiting with patients needing treatment. In Resus, 86-year-old Grahame has been rushed in with severe chest pains and blood in his mucus and after assessing him, Dr Staunton needs a conversation with him - in private

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc: PC Amy Hollis is on the hunt for a drunk driver who has been on a late-night wrecking spree through the streets of Chester, leaving a trail of damage to parked cars, while Mike Clark is cracking down on boy racers who are terrorising the locals in Warrington

programme.title: Police: Night Shift 999
programme.desc: Sgt Gladwin is caught off guard when a routine area search leaves him surrounded by an aggressive family, while an assault at a nightclub brings aggression and verbal abuse for police. A homeless man goes on the run after threatening a crowd with a glass bottle, while a violent shoplifter is cornered in a supermarket, and a car stop leads to international consequences

programme.title: Ambulance: Code Red
programme.desc: A critical care practitioner is dispatched to a double stabbing at a block of flats in Birmingham, and must prioritise which of the victims needs to be treated first

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: The LeoVegas Live Casino Show
programme.desc: Interactive gambling

programme.title: Hijacked
programme.desc: The documentary series turns attention to events in London in April, 1980, when six armed men from Iran seized control of the capital's Iranian embassy. Holding 26 people at gunpoint, the terrorists demanded the immediate release of political prisoners incarcerated in their homeland, and safe passage from the UK. If these demands were not met, the men claimed they would shoot all 26 of their hostages. Forty years later, first-hand accounts from some of the hostages, interviews with John Dellow of the Metropolitan Police and Gen Michael Rose of the SAS, and recorded footage from the incident are all brought together to provide an insight into the six-day ordeal that ended in a dramatic rescue operation

programme.title: Britain's Greatest Bridges
programme.desc: Engineer Rob Bell sets out on a journey to discover how six of Britain's most stunning bridges were designed and built. Completed in 1890, the Forth Rail Bridge now carries around 200 trains every day. The last of the great Victorian engineering triumphs, it has grown to symbolise Scotland as much as Edinburgh Castle, bagpipes or kilts. But, as Rob learns, this incredible engineering achievement was born from the tragedy of the 1879 Tay Bridge disaster, and 73 deaths were connected with its construction and immediate aftermath

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: The team treats an owl that refuses to fly and a badger with life-threatening injuries, while Simon tries to free a deer that has become stuck in railings

programme.title: The Fingerspellers
programme.desc: Comedy about a family of deaf gangsters who use signing to protect their interests. When the Opera family threaten their dominance, a fingerspelling war ensues

programme.title: 40 Guns to Apache Pass (1967)
programme.desc: A cavalry captain sets out to deliver a shipment of rifles to a fort besieged by marauding Apaches, but the mission is undermined by a villainous corporal who plans to steal the weapons and sell them to the enemy. Western, starring Audie Murphy, Michael Burns, Laraine Stephens, Kenneth Tobey and Michael Keep

programme.title: At Gunpoint (1955)
programme.desc: A peaceable shopkeeper becomes a local hero when he accidentally kills the leader of a gang of bank robbers. However, when the dead bandit's partners in crime come looking for retribution, he finds the friends and neighbours who praised his bravery are now about to abandon him. Western, starring Fred MacMurray, Dorothy Malone and Walter Brennan

programme.title: Billion Dollar Brain (1967)
programme.desc: Former secret agent Harry Palmer comes out of retirement to take a mysterious canister to Finland, and ends up embroiled in an American megalomaniac's bid to take over the world. Espionage thriller, directed by Ken Russell and starring Michael Caine, Oscar Homolka and Karl Malden

programme.title: O.S.S. (1946)
programme.desc: A spy is parachuted into France shortly before D-Day to complete a perilous top-secret mission. His team of expert operatives includes a strong-minded female agent - but sparks fly when the pair begin to work together, a situation which looks likely to lead to a crisis of conscience. Second World War adventure, starring Alan Ladd, Geraldine Fitzgerald, Patric Knowles and Richard Benedict

programme.title: My Super Ex-Girlfriend (2006)
programme.desc: Ordinary New Yorker Matt starts dating a woman he meets on the subway, unaware she is the superhero G-Girl. When he breaks up with the insecure crimefighter, she is outraged and uses her superpowers to make his life a misery. Meanwhile, her arch-enemy sees Matt as a potential ally in defeating G-Girl once and for all. Fantasy comedy, starring Uma Thurman, Luke Wilson and Eddie Izzard

programme.title: The Banshees of Inisherin Interview Special
programme.desc: The In Bruges team of Colin Farrell, Brendan Gleeson and writer/director Martin McDonagh talk about making their new film together, The Banshees of Inisherin

programme.title: Deadpool (2016)
programme.desc: A fast-talking former mercenary develops terminal cancer and agrees to be the subject in a shady experiment in the hope of a cure. The procedure leaves him horribly disfigured, but also possessing superhuman abilities which he immediately puts to use in a quest for revenge on the man responsible for his hideous appearance. Superhero comedy adventure, starring Ryan Reynolds and Morena Baccarin

programme.title: Punisher: War Zone (2008)
programme.desc: The ruthless vigilante considers hanging up his guns when he learns a gangster he killed was actually an undercover FBI agent. However, he must return to his war on crime when a mobster who was hideously disfigured at his hands assembles a gang of violent criminals to cause mayhem on the streets of New York. Action thriller based on the Marvel comic-book, starring Ray Stevenson and Dominic West

programme.title: Thunderbolt and Lightfoot (1974)
programme.desc: Retired bank robber John Doherty escapes a gunman with the aid of a young car thief, and together they go in search of the loot from the former crook's last job. When they discover the stash is missing - and John's thuggish old partners are also looking for it - the pair decide to do a repeat robbery. Comedy drama, starring Clint Eastwood, Jeff Bridges, George Kennedy and Geoffrey Lewis

programme.title: Apache Uprising (1965)
programme.desc: Western, starring Rory Calhoun as a tough-talking cowboy with a heart of gold who bravely defends fellow stagecoach passengers from a potentially lethal Indian attack. Also starring Corinne Calvet, Lon Chaney Jr and John Russell

programme.title: The Long Ships (1963)
programme.desc: A Viking warrior steals a ship and leads his crew in search of a legendary bell, rumoured to be three times the size of a man and made of solid gold. But they have reckoned without the ambition of the king of the Moors, who captures the Vikings and intends to use them to find the prize for himself. Adventure, starring Richard Widmark, Sidney Poitier, Rosanna Schiaffino, Russ Tamblyn and Lionel Jeffries

programme.title: We're No Angels (1955)
programme.desc: Three convicts escape from the penal colony on notorious Devil's Island and seize a French family's shop - only to find themselves helping the storekeeper outwit his scheming relatives. Comedy, starring Humphrey Bogart, Peter Ustinov, Aldo Ray and Basil Rathbone

programme.title: The Holly and the Ivy (1952)
programme.desc: A country parson's life is changed dramatically by a series of revelations at a Christmas family reunion. Drama, starring Ralph Richardson and Celia Johnson

programme.title: Bride Wars (2009)
programme.desc: Two lifelong best friends discover their weddings have been scheduled on the same day and at the same venue. Neither is prepared to back down, so a bitter rivalry ensues as years of friendship are cast aside in the struggle to sabotage each other's big day. Comedy, starring Kate Hudson, Anne Hathaway, Candice Bergen and Chris Pratt

programme.title: Glass (2019)
programme.desc: An invulnerable vigilante battles a murderer with multiple personalities - only for both to be apprehended and transferred to a mental hospital. They find themselves under the care of a sinister doctor who has plans concerning their unique abilities, but also sharing the facility with a third patient, a criminal mastermind the crime fighter had encountered before, and who is soon manipulating everyone to his own ends. M Night Shyamalan's fantasy thriller, crossing over the characters from his earlier films Unbreakable and Split. Starring James McAvoy, Bruce Willis and Samuel L Jackson

programme.title: Hitman (2007)
programme.desc: A genetically engineered assassin, who exists at the beck and call of a mysterious organisation, fails in his latest mission, and becomes a target himself, as security forces worldwide become aware of his existence and a rival agent is assigned to tie up loose ends. Action thriller, starring Timothy Olyphant, Dougray Scott and Olga Kurylenko

programme.title: Goat (2016)
programme.desc: New college student Brad is desperate to fit into his new surroundings, so taking a cue from his older brother, he decides to pledge a fraternity. All goes well at first as he attends parties and meets several girls, but as he enters into the final stretch of the pledging ritual-known as hell week, Brad finds things taking a violent turn as he has to endure a series of brutal initiation rituals. Fact-based drama, with Ben Schnetzer and Nick Jonas

programme.title: Ten Wanted Men (1955)
programme.desc: A law-abiding Arizona rancher runs into trouble when he unwittingly makes an enemy of a neighbouring landowner, who resents him for having befriended and comforted his abused mistress. The jealous man then recruits nine gunmen in a bid to drive his rival out of the territory. Western, starring Randolph Scott, Richard Boone, Donna Martell and Jocelyn Brando

programme.title: Wake of the Red Witch (1948)
programme.desc: A ship owner and his embittered captain engage in a battle of wills as they fight for the love of the same woman and embark on a quest for a treasure chest of pearls hidden in the den of an octopus in the South Seas. Romantic seafaring adventure, starring John Wayne, Luther Adler, Gig Young, Gail Russell and Adele Mara

programme.title: Dragoon Wells Massacre (1957)
programme.desc: A cavalry officer is assigned to escort a captured murderer to prison. However, the prisoner and his guard are compelled to join forces to survive when Apache warriors raid their wagon train as it moves across Arizona into hostile territory. Western, starring Barry Sullivan, Dennis O'Keefe, Mona Freeman and Katy Jurado

programme.title: Hobson's Choice (1953)
programme.desc: A cantankerous, overbearing boot-maker spends most of his time drinking while his three daughters push themselves to the limit taking care of his shop and home. A timid employee marries one of the sisters, then sets himself up as a rival for his business. Comedy, starring John Mills and Charles Laughton

programme.title: Bumblebee (2018)
programme.desc: In 1987, Californian teenager Charlie Watson is traumatised by the death of her father, while her mother Sally and new boyfriend Ron leaves her feeling even more alone. For her 18th-birthday she's given a yellow Volkswagen Beetle, which turns out to be the battle-scarred Autobot Bumblebee. Transformers prequel, starring Hailee Steinfeld, John Cena and Jorge Lendeborg Jr

programme.title: Titanic (1997)
programme.desc: A party of explorers studying the sunken remains of the famous liner meets an elderly woman who was a passenger on the ill-fated maiden voyage. She recounts how she boarded the ship while on the brink of being forced into marriage by her family, and was stopped from killing herself by a penniless artist. She fell in love with her saviour, but the disaster on the horizon meant their time together was doomed to be short. James Cameron's Oscar-winning romantic drama, starring Kate Winslet, Leonardo DiCaprio, Billy Zane, Kathy Bates and Bill Paxton

programme.title: Elle (2016)
programme.desc: After being raped in her home by a masked assailant, Michle Leblanc does not go to the police as she has far too many other things to concern herself with to put her life on hold. But when Michle starts getting text messages from the rapist describing her clothing and whereabouts, she arms herself with pepper spray and a small axe, considering all the men in her life a possible suspect. Paul Verhoeven's thriller, starring Isabelle Huppert. In French

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Peri breaks down to Nadira at the hospital, as the pair confide in one another. Warren goes to see Sienna to ask if he can take the twins on a day out to a safari park

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Darren tries to mediate between Nancy and Charlie, Damon surprises Brooke with a job offer, and Ste makes a shocking discovery

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Brick Hotel in Newtown, Pennsylvania, where the staff have had enough of owner Verindar, who runs the establishment like an angry tyrant. Can Gordon convince her to value her loyal workers and entice customers back to this landmark hotel?

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits the Beachfront Inn and Inlet, a Caribbean-style resort hotel in Fort Pierce, Florida. Young and inexperienced owner Brian is making guests' time at the hotel miserable with dusty rooms, late-night concerts and poor service. Can Gordon prevent the business from going under?

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Adam is surprised when he bumps into his first love, Dana. Meanwhile, Erica and Barry find out they have nowhere to live on their college campus

programme.title: The Goldbergs

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

Boyle is devastated when Vivian ends their relationship, so his colleagues try to cheer him up

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Peralta takes part in an undercover FBI operation that ends in a mass arrest. But when one of the mobsters escapes he enlists Boyle's help in tracking him down. Captain Holt tests the squad's patience with practice drills in which Sgt Jeffords plays different roles, while Gina pleads with Boyle to keep a secret. US cop comedy, starring Andy Samberg and Andre Braugher

programme.desc: Howard and Bernadette decide they do not want to know the gender of their unborn child, but are upset when they hear Raj has found out before they have. programme.title: Modern Family

programme.title: Modern Family

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

Having been reluctant to buy it just two and a half years ago, Nitasha has made the place home and believes it has the potential to be perfect for their future family. However, Nikunj feels like the work on the house will never be done, and would prefer to look for somewhere new

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Spanish architect Jaime and his wife Mimi as they embark on a mission to convert a Grade II listed folly into a family home in Buckinghamshire. Giving themselves a wildly optimistic six-month deadline to finish before the birth of their second child, it's not long before the couple hit trouble. Jaime puts all his energies and creativity into the project, using innovative 3D mapping to squeeze living spaces into the tower, but it proves to be an exhausting struggle

programme.title: Jonathan Ross' Myths and Legends
programme.desc: Jonathan is joined by Michael Sheen to explore the legends of Wales, from the creation of Mount Snowdon to the Lady of the Lake, and attends the Green Man Festival

programme.title: Secret History
programme.desc: One of the most devastating pandemics in human history, the Black Death swept through London in 1348, killing old and young, rich and poor, within days of their first symptoms. Received wisdom has long suggested the culprit was bubonic plague, spread by the fleas of infected rats, and an unexpected discovery made by Crossrail engineers working on a shaft on the edge of London's Charterhouse Square in 2013 provides a new insight into how the disease passed from host to host. This documentary follows experts from a range of disciplines as they pick through the evidence, reveal why the disease killed on such a large scale, and discuss how it still poses a threat today

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Train driver Andy, 48, is rushed in after falling 12ft from a tree while cutting branches and landing on his feet, badly fracturing both ankles, and doctors are concerned the impact may have caused life-changing damage to critical nerves and blood vessels in his feet and legs. Angela, 59, has come to St George's as her heart has been beating at over 150bpm for eight hours, risking stroke and other complications. Cardiologist Dr Arun's attempts to bring down her pulse using a powerful drug aren't successful, so he decides to electrically shock her heart to reset it

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau: DIY

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets energy conservationist Andrew, who has decided to build a radical, self-heating home for his family - the first of its kind in the UK. He aims to heat the house all year round by storing the warmth of the summer sun into insulated earth banks over and around the house, and then drawing the warmth back into the living spaces in winter. However, this pioneering construction seems an exercise in trial and error from the start, and what began as a seemingly simple, pure concept becomes a complicated feat of engineering

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: This documentary follows the arrest of a man on suspicion of conspiracy to murder. While driving to work, the victim was hit from behind by another vehicle, and while inspecting the damage was shot in the leg at close range by someone wielding a sawn-off shotgun. Detectives believe the case arises from a potential love triangle that has spiralled out of control - and have just 24 hours to gather sufficient evidence to bring charges, or release the suspect

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Ten-year-old Ashleigh is rushed to St George's by ambulance after twisting her leg while playing football. X-rays reveal that her femur is broken and she will need surgery. Meanwhile, three-year-old Lola visits A&E with her dad after having a seizure, and 91-year-old Betty arrives with severe chest pain. Doctors carry out a blood test in order to find out whether she is having a heart attack and will require life-saving surgery

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics Jan Vann and Chelsie Kennedy rush to a road traffic collision, but find the driver of the car has left the vehicle and doesn't want to be treated by the crew. The police suspect he may have been drinking, but the crew need to convince him to receive their help. In Coventry, paramedics Neil and Laura rush to a two-year-old boy who is having a severe allergic reaction

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: Cameras capture the work of some of Britain's busiest air ambulance teams as they race to save lives. The helicopter medics cut short an appearance at a charity event in Suffolk to treat a dirtbiker who's crashed at speed. Sammy has a cardiac arrest while working at a windfarm, and Stephen breaks his thigh while off-road motorbiking in the Pennines

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy words and numbers quiz, with Sean Lock and Danny Dyer taking on Joe Wilkinson and Gabby Logan, while David O'Doherty joins Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner and Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: Police officers request a new police support unit or riot van, while a stolen car chase ends with an X5 wedged in a hedge. Boss Mick Sweetmore goes back to the floor with Merseyside's mental health team and discovers another side to modern-day policing - as well as the poor state of the vehicle they are currently using

programme.title: The Force: Behind the Line
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary series. New South Wales police conclude a five-month heroin investigation and assist a female officer who has stopped a vehicle after seeing it do a burnout.

programme.title: The Force: Behind the Line
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary series. Queensland police run an operation to catch drivers breaking the rules on a busy esplanade, and a speeding driver in NSW is subjected to an RBT.

programme.title: Australian Ninja Warrior
programme.desc: It's the final heat before the semi-finals - 50 Ninjas are competing for the last 18 spots this time, and they will have to face some new obstacles to make it there

programme.title: Rick Stein's Road to Mexico
programme.desc: The chef retraces a road trip he took in 1968 down the Pacific Coast Highway to the Mexican border and beyond. He begins in San Francisco, the home of sourdough and where America's love affair with seasonal cooking took hold through restaurants like Chez Panisse, run by Alice Waters, who Rick is keen to meet. The chef also reflects on the time he had his first taste of Mexican food

programme.title: The Force: Behind the Line
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary series. Australian police investigate an elderly couple's pension plan in their back shed, an abandoned scooter, and reports of a clandestine drug laboratory.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: The team tries to save the police's ailing horse wagons. An officer escapes with his life after a pursuit car is rammed by a stolen 4x4, while the mounted unit keeps the peace at one of the biggest football clashes of the year

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The trio of motoring enthusiasts embark on another epic road trip, this time across western America in front-engined supercars. Jeremy Clarkson pilots the Lexus LFA, which has a spectacularly high-revving V10 powerplant, Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the muscular Dodge Viper, and James May opts for the latest incarnation of Aston Martin's Vanquish. On their journey from Las Vegas to Palm Springs via Los Angeles, the presenters tackle racing circuits and find themselves in a race against the police, before rushing to the Mexican border - and there's a terrifying penalty for the last man to arrive. Meanwhile, Fleetwood Mac drummer Mick Fleetwood rolls up his sleeves to thrash the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May embark on a race from London's Wembley Stadium to Milan's San Siro, the home of Italian football giants AC and Inter. A price restriction leads Jeremy to grab the keys to a Shelby Mustang GT500, which costs the equivalent of 35,000 in America and packs a supercharged punch of more than 650bhp. James and Richard pin their hopes on the pan-European rail network in a bid to secure the prize of tickets to a top-flight football match, with nothing but a long journey home awaiting the losers. On the test track, Jeremy puts Toyota's GT86 coupe through its paces, and its promise of entertaining rear-wheel-drive handling should put a smile on his face. Plus, singer-songwriter Amy Macdonald gets to grips with the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Australian Ninja Warrior
programme.desc: It's the first semi-final of the Aussie take on the hit format, but if the surviving Ninjas thought that the heats were tough, they apparently haven't seen anything yet

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade heads to the Canary Islands for a packed mini-break with actress and writer Lena Dunham, the star and creator of American comedy drama Girls. In the north of the island, Richard and Lena visit a guachinche pop-up restaurant, where they have goat stew before exploring the barren lunar-like landscape around the volcanic Mount Teide and spend the evening stargazing. There is also a sculpture tour, including works by Henry Moore and Joan Miro, as well as layered coffee, a spot of golf and a search for whales

programme.desc: Reluctant tourist Richard Ayoade is joined by comedian Matt Lucas for a frenetic 48 hours in the Italian capital. Their first challenge is finding suitable headgear to protect from the scorching Italian sun. They then take a guided tour in vintage Fiat 500 cars, and after wending their way past the Circus Maximus finish atop Gianicolo Hill in time for the cannon being fired - a daily ritual since the 1850s. Next they head to the border of the Vatican, before experiencing the very best of modern Italian cuisine. Day two sees visits to the Trevi Fountain and the Colosseum, perhaps Rome's most incredible antiquity

programme.desc: Michael Portillo learns more about the country's railways, beginning with the Great Eastern Line, which runs along the edge of England and into central London. programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Trans-Siberian Adventure
programme.desc: The actress embarks on her third travelogue, having previously traced the Nile from its source and sampled the varied rural, historical and urban cultures of Greece. This time, she sets out to travel 6,400 miles making use of the Trans-Siberian Railway, which is considered the longest railway line in the world. Joanna's journey begins in Hong Kong, where she spent some of her childhood. She takes a bullet train to Beijing, where she meets a woman who claims to have known the last Chinese emperor's favourite concubine, and officially joins the Trans-Siberian track. From there, she travels to the Great Wall, and takes an overnight train into Mongolia via the Gobi desert

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The third host in Huddersfield is school admin assistant Iram, who hopes to impress with classic Pakistani home cooking - even though it's the first dinner party she's ever hosted

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Trainee nurse Brilliance is the fourth person to host in the West Yorkshire town of Huddersfield. She hopes to give her guests an evening that they will never forget as she brings a taste of her native Zimbabwe. There's traditional Zulu dancing, lashings of salad cream and a rainbow-coloured main course, but whether it will be enough to bag her the 1,000 prize remains to be seen

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The last person to host in the West Yorkshire town of Huddersfield is NHS worker Adam, who attempts to win his guests over with a menu inspired by his favourite Chinese buffet in Spain. There's an impromptu lesson in sock puppetry which is both a hit and miss with certain guests, and a heady combo of burning hot chilli sauce and fish delights others. Just whether Adam's soiree warrants the week's top spot and the 1,000 cash prize remains to be seen

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jane and Jilly from Brighton look for a holiday home in the Dordogne region of south-west France. Laura Hamilton shows them five suitable properties for their 100,000 budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Having recently sold their business in Edinburgh, Gary and Kim Harrison cannot wait to find their dream holiday home on their favourite Caribbean island of St Lucia to enjoy their retirement. With a budget of 300,000, Danni Menzies delivers five properties with stunning views, but which one - if any - will steal their hearts and prompt them to make an offer?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Retired couple Alan and Marilyn McCubbine have decided that they want to spend the next chapter of their lives in the rugged countryside of Spain's Almera province. For their budget of 80,000, Danni Menzies shows them five great village properties

programme.title: Extraordinary Escapes with Sandi Toksvig
programme.desc: Sandi whisks panel show host, comedian and friend Sara Pascoe away on a trip to the wilds of Scotland's east coast, where they connect with nature and indulge in Sara's love of animals. They visit a magical forest cabin in Glen Dye, an award-winning architectural home in the East Neuk of Fife and a 16th-century castle on Glen Island

programme.title: Highclere: Behind the Scenes
programme.desc: Documentary following life at Highclere Castle, best known to Downton Abbey fans as the setting for the popular period drama, following Lord and Lady Carnarvon and their loyal staff as they strive to make this year the most profitable to date, with a busy calendar of events both home and away. Lady Carnarvon becomes an unexpected tour guide for some Americans who've turned up expecting a private tour of the famous castle. programme.title: Jamie's 1 Wonders
programme.desc: Jamie cooks a chicken and veg pie making full use of the store cupboard and freezer, topped with homemade pastry sprinkled with crispy chicken skin so that nothing goes to waste. programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody

DI Dale Mepstead turns her attention to two men who are seen on CCTV accompanying the suspects into a flat. Will either of the women being held in custody reveal their identity?

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Nine-year-old Kiya is given the best job ever - choosing a new furry friend out of a litter of three tiny cockapoos. Meanwhile, Wingnut the chihuahua has to prove to 16-year-old Jacob that chihuahuas are indeed cool and overexcited Yorkie Bam Bam needs to chill out if he is going to go home with Londoner Hannah

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: It's the battle of the cutest as two very different puppies are offered to Sonia and Andy and their two little girls. How will they cope cooped up in a caravan on-site with the children while they oversee the renovation?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Edinburgh, the first host is 37-year-old Canadian comedian Larah, who hopes to bag herself the prize with a night of fine dining. She aims to impress 38-year-old pilot James, 37-year-old cafe owner Nutan, 26-year-old salesman Sindiso and 42-year-old security manager Anne

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the second night from the competition in Edinburgh, and cafe owner Nutan is hoping her happy-go-lucky attitude will have her laughing all the way to the bank

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The third host of the week in Edinburgh is South-African born family man Sindiso, who hopes an evening of fun inspired by his homeland will win him the 1,000 prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Edinburgh security company manager Anne hopes her homely, relaxed night in will be enough to win the 1,000 prize - but rising tensions between the guests may scupper her chances

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It's the final night in Edinburgh, and pilot James is hoping a touch of sophistication in his high-flying menu will see him land safely in first place. Will James manage to produce excellent food and keep the peace, leading him to victory?

programme.desc: A few years ago Kieran Alexander was involved in a serious motorbike accident that has given her, and partner Dave Dwyer, a new outlook on life - that it is for living and there is no time like the present. They've decided to leave their stressful lives in the UK behind and start again in the Azores in the Atlantic. With a budget of 100,000 to fund their new home, Ben Hillman shows them five properties on the main island of Sao Miguel

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: B&B owners in Andalusia find that their property is on a very slippery slope. In Portugal, two surfers start a brewery, and an entrepreneur from Yorkshire opens a yurt restaurant

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Media sales executive and music mad foodie Richard Kaye hosts the second dinner party in Exeter, where he is confident he can impress his guests with his culinary knowledge, and hopes to dazzle one diner in particular

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Customer services adviser Sarah Wallis is the fourth host in Exeter, and despite holding back all week she hopes to come out of her shell with an evening full of humour. The guests are welcomed in a terrifying manner, before being served some rather unusual cocktails

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: When a man is found dead and completely naked after bleeding out from a stab wound to his thigh, Bedfordshire's Major Crime unit charge two women who they believe enticed the man into meeting them with the promise of sex, but instead had the intention of robbing him. CCTV reveals the women were accompanied by two men on the night of the murder. Now with four suspects in custody, investigators need to work out who is behind the 'honey trap' plot and which of their suspects is responsible for the murder

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The air ambulance is dispatched to collect Frances, an 80-year-old woman who fell three metres into her empty swimming pool while gardening, and has sustained a head wound that could have resulted in a life-altering bleed on the brain. Ruth, aged 86, arrives at St George's A&E with her heart beating three times faster than the normal rate. Doctors are concerned it may not be pumping enough blood around her body, and quickly prescribe fast-acting medication. Plus, students Jerry and Sakille turn up at the hospital after Jerry crashed her car on the way home from a party. programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Alarm-company owner Bill Black kicks off a series of dinner parties in Dundee, where he hopes his belt-busting menu will impress his guests - proud Arbroathian Phil Petrie, English student Hannah Wilson, ferret fancier Alex Pithouse and 28-year-old Kim Gillespie - and make him an early contender for the 1,000 prize

programme.desc: Vegetarian Hannah Wilson prepares an Italian feast for her guests in Dundee, and in a bid to win over her carnivore guests she devises a cunning plan that involves dishing up some meat with the starter

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Musician Donagh is taking the giant step of relocating to the vibrant Spanish city of Valencia. Donagh has a maximum budget of 125,000 and a long wishlist, so the pressure is on Scarlette to deliver

programme.desc: A woman who has taken drugs and is hallucinating causes a challenge at a hotel, and a worried mother rings for help when her child is feverish and unable to speak. There are fears of Covid-19 with a patient who is short of breath and has a temperature

programme.desc: On the beat with the police officers of Brighton after dark. Young officers Matt and Will stop an ex-police chief for suspected driving under the influence. Sophie and Rachel investigate a possible street assault that has left a man with life-threatening injuries and Steve comes across a pair of legs sticking out of the bushes. programme.desc: Roger and Lisa are used to spending more than 8,000 holidaying abroad in luxury villas with their young three children. And 100 miles west in Southport live Sue, Genna and Ray. Nan and mum work so much that they rarely have time for holidays. While Lisa and Roger have a trip to windy Wales in a campervan, Sue, Genna and Ray are treated to an all-expenses paid trip to a Devon manor frequented by the super-rich

programme.desc: Dave has just four weeks to complete the refurbishment of his bar, but he has a mountain to climb to get everything finished so he can open on time. Lorraine has taken over a local beauty salon and in an effort to attract new clients she decides to put on a spectacular hair and beauty show, while local musician Mykal performs a new song that he has written

programme.title: Car Pound Cops: Give Me My Car Back!
programme.desc: Following the work of recovery crews as they trace, track and tow vehicles driven illegally on Britain's roads

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: Catching up with tenants and landlords from previous episodes, including a man living in a damp and mouldy flat, who was unable to sleep in the bedroom due to the horrendous conditions. The programme also revisits a 70-year-old landlady whose tenants stopped paying the rent for a year, and the council's Rogue Landlord Team in Lewisham, who learned where a slum property owner's reputation for a short fuse came from

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: North Yorkshire officers are called out to a massive crash near a theme park that has resulted in the death of at least one person. The need to understand what has happened and who - if anyone - is to blame tests the resources of all the traffic cops who attend and then investigate this fatal incident. Will their gut instincts that this is a drug-fuelled disaster prove correct?

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston presents an edition focusing on the hunt for disqualified, unlicensed and uninsured drivers. In Bradford, officers from the West Yorkshire Safer Roads team pursue a desperate and disqualified driver through the city streets, while a member of the public is forced into making a citizen's arrest when another banned motorist attempts to flee the scene of a crash. In York, a pensioner is knocked down in a hit-and-run incident and an urgent search for the culprit gets under way

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: The team carries out a raid that turns up a stash of drugs, a weapon and a large pile of cash, while Jon Peacock is amazed to encounter a half-naked man covered in blood on the wintry streets of Lincoln, but the real surprise comes when the officer finds out what he has been up to. Suspicious driving leads Jim Woolerton to discover super-strength lager and drugs, and a speeding motorist comes out with a very middle-class excuse after being clocked travelling at 110mph

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Dan Brigginshaw tracks down a driver who has given him the slip on the side roads of Spalding, while Suzie Ranyard comes to the rescue of a motorist with a rather large passenger. Jim Woolerton utilises some of the unit's most advanced kit to catch out a disqualified driver and officers are called out when a dead body is spotted in one of Lincolnshire's many waterways

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: The dog unit embarks on a desperate manhunt amid fears that an armed and dangerous character is roaming the streets of Lincoln, while Craggy closes in on a suspected shoplifter with a bag full of surprises. Officers from Lincolnshire's Roads Policing Unit also tackle a would-be stunt rider and a boozed-up biker who is raising hell on the A-roads

programme.title: Car Pound Cops: Give Me My Car Back!
programme.desc: Following the work of recovery crews as they trace, track and tow vehicles driven illegally on Britain's roads

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Stacey begs Rose to keep her secret, and Leah gives Kirby a financial lifeline, while Mackenzie and Gabe mix business and pleasure

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: After taking Gabe home for a steamy reunion, Mackenzie is caught with her pants down by Dean, whose mum, Karen, invites herself to move in

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: A woman struggling to walk and suffering from dizzy spells visits the surgery, and doctors worry that her rapid decline may be caused by a rare muscle wasting disease. A patient dealing with chronic pain and fatigue is also treated, and a schoolgirl with a mysterious rash is examined by the doctors

programme.title: Casualty 24/7: Every Second Counts
programme.desc: Doctors in the accident and emergency department treat a patient in cardiac arrest. Junior doctor George Kay leads the resus team, while Hannah Ryan steps in to head up the nurses. Meanwhile, cyclist Garry is rushed into hospital after a head-on collision with a metal gate, and elderly patient Larry comes to hospital with his wife Molly after he had a fall at home

programme.title: HMP Wakefield: Evil Behind Bars
programme.desc: Through interviews with ex-inmates, retired guards and relatives of Britain's most infamous inmates, this documentary uncover secrets of life inside one of the UK's toughest jails. Exclusive phone calls from one of the UK's longest-serving inmates, Charles Bronson, reveal first-hand what life is really like as inmate in Wakefield Prison, and there are never-before-told stories from inside the walls of Wakefield about Jeremy Bamber, arguably as famous for his fight to get out of prison as for the crimes he committed to be sent there

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV is helping to bring criminals using weapons to justice. A CCTV operator's instincts lead him to keep an eye on a man acting suspiciously on a train station platform and who then takes a knife out of his pocket and threatens a woman coming towards him. There is also footage of a raid on a west London jewellery shop, with the gang spraying bleach in the eyes of security guards and smashing down the doors with pickaxes while the terrified staff cower inside

programme.title: Adults Only

programme.title: Police Interceptors

Dr Tom Pelly helps Vera, who is worried that her bad shoulder might be a sign of worse things to come, and Dr Alison Bolam solves the mystery of why visually impaired patient David is experiencing pain in his eyes and face. Crime drama, starring Michael Weatherly and Cote de Pablo

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Tony and Ziva track a suspected terrorist to a warehouse, where they find traces of radioactive metal - together with evidence suggesting a nuclear attack is being planned on Washington, DC. Unfortunately, news of the threat leaks out to the public, triggering widespread panic. Naval crime drama, starring Mark Harmon

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Iraq war veteran Damon Werth asks Gibbs and the team to investigate the death of another former marine, who was murdered while working as a lorry driver, so Ziva hits the road to catch the killer. Joe Spano and Paul Telfer guest star

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU tries to stop the killing spree of a couple who met through Alcoholics Anonymous. The pair ignored the crucial 13th step of resisting intimate relationships with recovering patients and set out on a drunken massacre. Guest starring Adrianne Palicki and Jonathan Tucker

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team sets out to find a murderous taxi driver with an acute sense of smell who targets women with a strong natural scent, dumping their bodies with a square of skin removed from their feet. programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

programme.desc: A power cut plunges most of the city into darkness, and Pride is approached by his daughter's best friend, Frankie, who claims to have received an unnerving message from her fiance Nick, who has gone missing. Using background noise from his message, the team deduces Nick's location, but finds he has been killed. A chain of evidence leads to an abandoned house containing blueprints for New Orleans' electric grids, as well as the murder weapon, and as Pride and his colleagues investigate further, they begin to suspect Nick's death and the blackout are connected to an opportunistic gang planning to use the power cut as a cover for a looting spree. However, there is more to the case than meets the eye. Crime drama, starring Scott Bakula

programme.title: Star Trek: Voyager

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A US Marine, a waitress and a chef are shot dead at a diner, in what is thought to be a bungled robbery. However, when the team arrives to investigate, a previously unknown witness emerges from the eatery's freezer, claiming the killer had an unusual tattoo. The statement rings alarm bells for LaSalle, who realises the circumstances of the killings match those of his first-ever case with Pride 10 years earlier, which remained unsolved after Hurricane Katrina devastated the crime scene. Convinced their killer has struck again, he and Pride work together once again in an attempt to achieve closure once and for all. Naval crime drama, starring Lucas Black and Scott Bakula

programme.title: S.W.A.T.
programme.desc: Hondo and the team race to save their former unit leader Buck Spivey when he goes off grid and they fear he plans to harm himself. programme.title: Pocket Dragon Adventures
programme.desc: A group of very small dragons live with a kindly old wizard, they're not big enough to fly but that doesn't stop them having many adventures

programme.title: Extreme Dinosaurs
programme.desc: 65 Million years ago, Dinosaurs disappeared. Now they're Back! T-Bone, Spike, Bullzeye, and Stegz. Four prehistoric dinosaurs, evolved into intelligent beings reawaken in a bizarre new world

programme.title: Stone Age

programme.title: Stone Age

programme.title: Kong: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Kong, Jason, jungle girl Lua, fun-loving Tann and wise Dr. Jenkins take on power-hungry scientists, ferocious prehistoric creatures and incredible magical beings to protect their unique island home

programme.title: The Most Dangerous Ways to School
programme.desc: Children who take treacherous journeys to school, climbing up mountainous paths, swimming across rivers or fighting their way through icy wastelands

programme.title: Plane Crash Recreated
programme.desc: Arguably the deadliest single-aircraft accident in aviation history, in August 1985, when a Boeing 747 jumbo-jet suffered a fatal decompression that ripped off most of the tail

programme.title: Terry and Mason's Great Food Trip
programme.desc: London cabbie Mason McQueen and Terry Wogan head to Marlow, where they are intrigued to discover the historic Buckinghamshire town boasts many food producers and restaurants. The duo are served up a dish by Michelin-starred chef Atul Kochhar, treated to a pub lunch by Tom Kerridge and after Mason has a go at rowing on the River Thames, it's time to sample the county's regional dish of Bacon Badger

programme.title: Big City Life
programme.desc: The lives of three artistic brothers, a drummer, a sculpture and a DJ

programme.title: Monkey
programme.desc: Another chance to see the classic fantasy drama series following Buddhist priest Tripitaka and his three disciples Monkey, Pigsy and Sandy, as they travel from China to India in search of Buddhist scriptures. Monkey is summoned to Heaven where he is imprisoned under a mound of rocks. Masoaki Sakai, Toshiyuki Nishida, Shiro Kishibe and Masako Natsume star

programme.title: A Place of One's Own (1945)
programme.desc: An ageing couple move into a haunted house, where their companion becomes possessed by the spirit of a murdered girl. Ghost story, starring James Mason, Barbara Mullen, Margaret Lockwood, Dennis Price, Dulcie Gray and Michael Shepley

programme.title: Clambake (1967)
programme.desc: A millionaire's son is determined to succeed on his own, so changes places with a poor water-skiing instructor to prove he can live without the perks of wealth. Musical, with Elvis Presley, Shelley Fabares, Bill Bixby and Will Hutchins

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing Notting Hill for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: The crew of Moonbase Alpha encounters a doomed planet. Sci-fi adventure, starring Martin Landau and Barbara Bain

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London

programme.title: The Baron
programme.desc: An antique dealer is murdered by American mobsters. Though the coroner's verdict is one of accidental death, Mannering is not convinced

programme.title: Cat Hospital
programme.desc: Cat-catchers Maggie and Jim attempt to round-up a colony of farm cats. However, the task proves harder than they imagined. Harley comes to the hospital for routine check-up, but Claire discovers a murmur. Elsewhere, Martina searches for an effective stress relief for her cat

programme.title: Danger Dogs
programme.desc: Documentary following dogs and their trainers as they are put through their paces in everything from sniffing out drugs to finding roadside bombs in conflict zones

programme.title: The Comic Strip Presents
programme.desc: Female aliens invade Earth looking for men to breed with so they can repopulate their planet, but reckon without the interference of a secret agent

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: London cabbie Mark Monroe takes you to the hidden and more quirky parts of the amazing city that normally lie undiscovered

programme.title: White Collar Boxing League
programme.desc: Fast-paced adrenaline-filled White Collar Boxing from The WBCL. Fighting talk, getting up close and personal to the competitors in and out of the ring

programme.title: Perrier's Bounty (2009)
programme.desc: A man borrows money from a loan shark, but ends up with a price on his head when he cannot pay it back. In desperation, he joins a gang of thieves to raise the money, but when a simple robbery goes horribly wrong, finds himself with a second lot of crooks on his trail. Comedy thriller, starring Cillian Murphy, Brendan Gleeson and Jim Broadbent

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Featuring Woolwich, Deptford and Lewisham. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Albatross (2011)
programme.desc: Bookish teenager Beth is desperate to escape her dull home life. She finds a kindred spirit in Emelia, a troubled 17-year-old with dreams of becoming a writer, who comes to work at her parents' hotel. Emelia forms a friendship with Beth, but also has an affair with her father, which threatens to tear the family apart. Drama, with Jessica Brown Findlay, Felicity Jones, Sebastian Koch and Julia Ormond

programme.title: The Cat and the Canary (1978)
programme.desc: Friends and relatives of a dead millionaire gather for the reading of his will. A taped message from the deceased expresses his loathing of his legatees, and the conditions attached to the will are deliberately designed to have them at each other's throats. Moreover, it seems at least one of the potential beneficiaries is prepared to commit murder to guarantee getting the money. Thriller, starring Honor Blackman, Michael Callan and Edward Fox

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Wings of Mystery (1963)
programme.desc: A group of youngsters and their prized pigeon help prevent the theft of a new alloy from a Sheffield steelworks. Children's adventure, starring Judy Geeson and Hennie Scott

programme.title: Roswell Conspiracies
programme.desc: The story of allied intelligence agents who've discovered aliens on Earth who are bent on taking over the world. In response, the agents form a top-secret multinational agency, The Global Alliance

programme.title: Dork Hunters from Outer Space
programme.desc: Alien Dorks disguise themselves as humans to use Earth as a base to take over the universe, but they face opposition from some unlikely teenage heroes

programme.title: Pocket Dragon Adventures
programme.desc: A group of very small dragons live with a kindly old wizard, they're not big enough to fly but that doesn't stop them having many adventures

programme.title: Extreme Dinosaurs
programme.desc: 65 Million years ago, Dinosaurs disappeared. Now they're Back! T-Bone, Spike, Bullzeye, and Stegz. Four prehistoric dinosaurs, evolved into intelligent beings reawaken in a bizarre new world

programme.title: Stone Age
programme.desc: Meet a group of typical suburban nine-year-old kids with friends, foes and families kicking it really old school, in prehistoric times

programme.title: Stone Age
programme.desc: Meet a group of typical suburban nine-year-old kids with friends, foes and families kicking it really old school, in prehistoric times

programme.title: Kong: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Kong, Jason, jungle girl Lua, fun-loving Tann and wise Dr. Jenkins take on power-hungry scientists, ferocious prehistoric creatures and incredible magical beings to protect their unique island home

programme.title: The Most Dangerous Ways to School
programme.desc: Children who take treacherous journeys to school, climbing up mountainous paths, swimming across rivers or fighting their way through icy wastelands

programme.title: Rudyard Kipling: A Secret Life
programme.desc: A profile of the author, which looks at how the writer's childhood and the loss of two of his three children influenced his work

programme.title: Floyd on Britain and Ireland
programme.desc: The chef samples the food of Northumberland, and cooks a pork, vegetable, wine and herb stew after being inspired by the sight of Hadrian's Wall. Plus, he takes a trip on a trawler boat and prepares a panache of fish

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring Forest Hill, Hither Green and Cubitt Town. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: World Natural Heritage: USA
programme.desc: Yellowstone is the oldest national park in the world, home to the world's highest concentration of geysers and thermal springs as well as herds of bison that roam the highlands

programme.title: Keep Fit (1937)
programme.desc: A weedy barber tries to get into shape, and ends up challenging a brawny love rival to a boxing match. Musical comedy, starring George Formby and Kay Walsh

programme.title: Seance on a Wet Afternoon (1964)
programme.desc: A self-professed medium with a greed for money and publicity arranges the kidnap of a wealthy industrialist's daughter, with the intention of winning acclaim and the ransom when she locates the child using her alleged psychic powers. British psychological thriller, starring Kim Stanley, Richard Attenborough, Mark Eden, Nanette Newman, Gerald Sim and Judith Donner

programme.title: The Baron
programme.desc: An antique dealer is murdered by American mobsters. Though the coroner's verdict is one of accidental death, Mannering is not convinced

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London

programme.title: Royals and Animals: Til Death Do Us Part
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the extraordinary relationship between the Windsor's and their animals

programme.title: The Prisoner
programme.desc: Number Six is accused of disrupting the ordered routine of the Village, and as punishment is subjected to a lobotomy experiment designed to determine if sound waves and drugs can alter a man's personality

programme.title: The Long Firm
programme.desc: Harry's dreams of building an empire fade as the Sixties draw to a close, and he spends his time with an alcoholic pill-pusher who spirals into paranoia and anxiety, haunted by the memory of his role in an accident that killed his wife. Harry becomes increasingly depressed, until the murder of a rent boy catches his attention and his obsessive quest to solve the mystery takes him to Teddy Thursby's house - and a discovery that shocks the hard-boiled villain to the core

programme.title: Eden Lake (2008)
programme.desc: A couple on a romantic break find their peace shattered by a gang of youths who steal their belongings and vandalise their car. However, when they confront the youngsters they are subjected to a horrific attack, resulting in a deadly game of cat and mouse through the woodland. Horror, starring Kelly Reilly and Michael Fassbender

programme.title: My Left Foot (1989)
programme.desc: Biopic of Irish writer and artist Christy Brown, who had cerebral palsy leaving him unable to control most of his body. Born into a large, poor family, Christy is disregarded as a hopeless case by the medical establishment, but encouraged by his devoted mother as he learns to write and draw with his left foot. Starring an Oscar-winning Daniel Day-Lewis and Brenda Fricker

programme.title: White Collar Boxing League
programme.desc: Fast-paced adrenaline-filled White Collar Boxing from The WBCL. Fighting talk, getting up close and personal to the competitors in and out of the ring

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours narrated by Dewyne Lindsay, this time exploring and revealing New Cross, Eltham, and Catford

programme.title: North West Frontier (1959)
programme.desc: A British officer saves an Indian prince from an uprising and tries to escort him and the boy's nanny to safety on board a dilapidated train. However, his mission is jeopardised when it becomes clear there is a traitor on board, leading to a deadly game of cat and mouse. Action adventure, starring Lauren Bacall, Kenneth More, Herbert Lom and Wilfrid Hyde White

programme.title: Monkey

Monkey is summoned to Heaven where he is imprisoned under a mound of rocks. Masoaki Sakai, Toshiyuki Nishida, Shiro Kishibe and Masako Natsume star

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: The crew of Moonbase Alpha encounters a doomed planet. Sci-fi adventure, starring Martin Landau and Barbara Bain

programme.title: Clambake (1967)
programme.desc: A millionaire's son is determined to succeed on his own, so changes places with a poor water-skiing instructor to prove he can live without the perks of wealth. Musical, with Elvis Presley, Shelley Fabares, Bill Bixby and Will Hutchins

programme.title: The Bulldog Breed (1960)
programme.desc: A bumbling grocer is rejected by the woman of his dreams, plunging him into misery. He decides to get over his heartbreak by joining the Navy, and despite his ineptitude, is selected by an admiral to become Britain's first astronaut. Comedy, starring Norman Wisdom, Ian Hunter, David Lodge and John Le Mesurier

programme.title: Cat Hospital
programme.desc: Cat-catchers Maggie and Jim attempt to round-up a colony of farm cats. However, the task proves harder than they imagined. Harley comes to the hospital for routine check-up, but Claire discovers a murmur. Elsewhere, Martina searches for an effective stress relief for her cat

programme.title: Danger Dogs
programme.desc: Documentary following dogs and their trainers as they are put through their paces in everything from sniffing out drugs to finding roadside bombs in conflict zones

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London

programme.title: Shine On Harvey Moon
programme.desc: An RAF clerk returns from the war to find his house in ruins - destroyed not by German bombs, but by his wife forgetting to turn off the gas

programme.title: Plane Crash Recreated
programme.desc: The story of Air France Flight 447, a scheduled passenger flight from Rio de Janeiro to Paris which dramatically vanished over the Atlantic Ocean in June 2009

programme.title: The Hidden City
programme.desc: Drama following a group of young homeless people living in the streets of London for one year

programme.title: United (2011)
programme.desc: Drama charting the story of the 'Busby Babes' - the Manchester United side who became the youngest-ever winners of the English Football League in 1956. Having won the league again in 1957, the team reaches the quarter-finals of the European Cup in 1958 - but disaster strikes as they return from the match in Belgrade, when their charter plane crashes following a refuelling stop in Munich. The disaster claims the lives of 23 people, including eight players - and with manager Matt Busby in a critical condition, coach Jimmy Murphy tries to rebuild the shattered team. Starring David Tennant, Jack O'Connell, Sam Claflin and Dougray Scott

programme.title: Perrier's Bounty (2009)

programme.desc: A thief seeks refuge in a grand castle, and is pleasantly surprised by the two beautiful women living there. However he soon realises his seductive hosts are addicted to drinking fresh human blood. French horror, starring Brigitte Lahaie, Franca Mai and Jean-Marie Lemaire

programme.title: George Russell F1 Winner

programme.title: Rookies Karting
programme.desc: Ahead of their rookie Formula 1 seasons, Oscar Piastri and Nyck de Vries go karting with Sky F1's Anthony Davidson and Naomi Schiff
